ResponsesInList.Title: Possibility to let students confirm their appointment made in scheduler?
ResponsesInList.Text:
We use the scheduler activity for students to be able to book a timeslot for a company visit. We publisch the scheduler a few weeks ahead of the actual visit and registration is on first-come-first-served basis. Regularly student drop out of the program, even though the have registered for a company visit in the future. Can we set up the scheduler activity to send not only a reminder mail one week in advance, but to als show a button in that mail (or in the scheduler activity on Moodle) that students need to click to reconfirm their intent to show up? And if they do not reconfirm by 48 hours in advance, the timeslot of the non-responders tot the confirmation mail need to be released so that others have the chance to attend. How could this be achieved on Moodle (even if with another activity than the scheduler, I would be happy to hear it).

We now have a very labor-intensive workaround that we have to maintain for quite a lot of schedulers (we have a lot of company visits) and we need to improve this process: 1 - When the scheduler is first published, the completion status of that activity cannot be manipulated by a student 2 - One week i advance, the reminder mail is sent out. We cannot choose the teckt of that mail 3 - On the same day, the teacher sets the completion status so that it must be set manually by a student. 4 - The teacher then also checks who is registered and sends all these students an e-mail asking them to set the completion status of the correct scheduler activity to "completed" 5 - 48 hours in advance, the teacher does a cross check between who is registered and who has set the completion status to "completed". 6 - All registered students that have not set the completion status are deemed as unconfirmed and their registration is removed so that others have the chance to register and attend 7 - An e-mail to all students who could not register is sent out that new places have opened up.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Possibility to let students confirm their appointment made in scheduler?
ResponsesInList.Text: Anybody with suggestions? I placed this in the "shceduler plugin" section, but if anyone has any suggestions how the described flow could be obtained with another activity in Moodle, that would be fine. We are not bound to the scheduler activity. We just need something that works and supports the functional need we have ....

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Repeated Slots that ignore conflicting Schedules
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Symon, Have you tried "Force when overlap" > Yes (Add repeated slots) or "Ignore scheduling conflicts" > Check (Add single slot)? Regards, Sébastien

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Repeated Slots that ignore conflicting Schedules
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Seb. I already know of all these methods. I would just want to suggest the feature because it is too tiring to make individual slots just because I want my slots to ignore conflict with others. Is it really not possible to mass-make slots that does that?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Repeated Slots that ignore conflicting Schedules
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Symon, That's right, "Force when overlap" deletes conflicting slots. There is a way around it though, but that would require using an alternate version of the plugin. There is this version developped by Fred Massart for Royal College of Art for which he added a slot import feature. I'm using a Scheduler based on this version and I could check that importing slots enables multiple conflicting slots. You simply import slots through a csv file like the one attached. You can pull the code of this Scheduler version from here: https://github.com/branchup/moodle-mod_scheduler/tree/rca-404-stable Cheers, Sébastien

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler Date Text Missing
ResponsesInList.Text: I know -- it's super easy to assume the wrong date and I was never able to figure out any CSS to assist here. I think a tracker might be the best route to request the plugin maintainer get that hard coded in or to have some time of line separating the different days.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler Date Text Missing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, In my experience this has never been an issue for our users, but if you think you need to change it and you can't do it through a CSS , you can always deactivate the code that provokes this behaviour. It's in renderer.php and is introduced with the comment "// Simplify display of dates, start and end times." It's in 2 locations in the file, the first one for student display, the second one for teachers and staff. In the latest version (4.0.0) that's lines 626-642 and 744-760. Here's the code: // Simplify display of dates, start and end times. if ($startdate == $previousdate && $starttime == $previoustime && $endtime == $previousendtime) { // If this row exactly matches previous, there's nothing to display. Cheers, Sébastien

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler across site or multiple courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Hillel, The solution I've found is to use a meta course and place the scheduler there. Inês

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler across site or multiple courses
ResponsesInList.Text: I agree that using a metacourse is the best option. Just to note that the issue is raised once in a while, but it's really related to Moodle's core architecture, not Scheduler itself. To be specific, Scheduler is an "activity module" in Moodle parlance (like Assignment, Glossary, Quiz and others) , and instances of activities need to be tied to a course. Hence every Scheduler needs to be attached to a course (or perhaps the front page , which is also a kind of course). Users need to be enrolled in that course in order to make a booking.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler across site or multiple courses

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler across site or multiple courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi again, Students only need to be enrolled in one of those courses. You need to set up a new course, which will be the meta course with Scheduler. Check with your admin if Course meta link is turned on. Then, you'll be able to easily add all your students to your new course by going to Participants>Enrolment methods>Course meta link and choosing the 3 courses you want to link.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler across site or multiple courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Spyros, For 1), you can add a "link" as an activity in the 4 courses that takes learners to the scheduler. If you want something more interactive, you can also create a button with bootstrap: https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/components/buttons/ For 2), I think the easiest way would be to ask students to write which course they're enrolled in the "message" box in the booking form. There are multiple options when it comes to the grades, I think the simplest one would be to add a grade item in the gradebook. However, teachers will need to add the grades directly in the gradebook/with a .csv file. Do you think that this is feasible for them?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students cannot book appointments
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, Przemek Kaszubski, for your reply. However, I am not sure I fully understand your answer. The groups I mentioned are student groups, which are created by themselves, and represent a set of students that work together in the course. They submit works together, as a group, and through out the course they interact with each other to accomplish the course’s tasks. I guess this organization (sets of students that work in group) is pretty common in many courses (either supported by a platform like Moodle or without any platform). So, what would be the logic of adding a teacher to a group of students? Or, for that matter, adding a teacher to all groups of students in a course? Please don’t take me wrong. I truly believe that your solution works for the Scheduler plugin. I am just trying to understand its logic, as I have this feeling that I am missing something (maybe the ideia I had about groups is just wrong). Best regards, Miguel

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students cannot book appointments
ResponsesInList.Text: Groups in a Moodle course can be set up for different purposes, whether course groups or task groups or some other ad-hoc groups, and anyone can be a member of multiple groups etc. Not sure which version of Moodle you're using, too, but group management is becoming an increasingly more important feature (also because of privacy issues). If the mode for an activity is a group mode (separate or visible) and not "No groups", and no teacher or non-editing teacher is added to the group, then there is no one of an upper rank in that group directly assigned to book an appointment with (or to be graded by, as in assignments, or to respond to the group's forum discussions etc). Yes, a general course teacher ("editing teacher") can do many things, but that is because editing teachers act also like managers or moderators in the entire course (with access to all groups defined in that course). S/he can thus step in anywhere and do whatever. If there are groups in a course, and you're not in them, these are dubbed as "groups" simply (or "Other groups"), but not "My groups". For those groups that do not need a grader, a TA, or other dedicated "contact" , you might not have to add a teacher (or non-editing teacher), but for those groups that collaborate and submit things that are supposed to be graded or monitored by a teacher, that teacher should be specified - otherwise communications will often fail - forum subscriptions, assignment notifications, and also scheduler appointments. If you had 5 teachers sharing a course and teaching 5 different groups, you wouldn't want to have each of the teachers tracking all of the students all of the time, just the group they are actually teaching. Ergo - if you have at least one activity in your course that applies a separate groups or visible groups mode, then including the dedicated teacher(s) in each such group is at the very least recommended practice.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students cannot book appointments
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Przemek Kaszubski: Thank you very much for your thoughtful response. I really appreciate your help in this subject. In fact, as you pointed out, the concept of "groups" in Moodle goes far beyond simple “task-groups”. And I was missing its greater scope. As you guessed, my case is characterized by: 1) My course groups are "task-groups" and I'm the only teacher in the course. 2) These "task-groups" are the only groups in the course, and I would prefer not to add myself to each of them. So, I'll try your suggestions, hopping they accomplish want I intend with the Scheduler, which seemed to me pretty trivial: just set up a pool of slots that students could book, in a per group (a "task-group") basis, to meet me. Again, many thanks for your help (and for your time!). Best regards, Miguel

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle deletes appointments and sheduler before slots end
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello the way that Scheduler behaves is as follows: a slot is bookable only until its start time (or in fact a certain time before that, if so configured). If the start time is in the past and the slot is empty (ie no student has booked it), it will be deleted. You can disable the automatic deletion, though, by disabling the "Purge unused slots in the past" task via Moodle's admin menu.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: And suddenly, a missing slot
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm updating my post since we've been digging around in the log database after several tests. We discovered that if you are a teacher, you can perform the following tasks without the logs being visible in the database: - add a student to a slot - delete a student for a specific slot - revoke all students in a slot We think this might explain some of the apparent bugs described in this discussion. For example, if you (mistakenly) revoke all students, then the slot becomes unused and is purged. We can't prove this, but it could be an explanation in our case. We don't understand how it is possible to have no logs with such actions?

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler for Moodle 4.x
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Scheduler users I have been quiet for some time on a release of Scheduler for Moodle 4.0 and beyond, mostly due to lack of available time. However, the master branch of Scheduler (on github) has over time been supplied with Moodle 4.x specific fixes, and should meanwhile be working fine (or at least without limitations that occurred in earlier versions of Moodle as well). Thanks to everyone who contributed fixes or reported issues on the Moodle Tracker . Behat tests indicate that Scheduler is now compatible with the latest Moodle 4.2 as well. I am therefore planning to (finally!) release a new 4.x version of Scheduler to the plugins DB in two weeks from now, that is, around mid-May. If anyone notices any 4.x-specific issues before then, please do report them to the Tracker and I will try to fix them before the release. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: bulk export of info contained in different schedulers
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Use case description - I have a course with a lot of schedulers where students needed to register for webinars provided by external partners. Due to covid restrictions, there was no possibility to go to companies with students to get a feel for what te studies are preparing them. Some external partners did webinars via Zoom, others via Teams, others via Webex. All platforms where we do not have access to participant logs, or where anyone with the link could enter. Attendance in at least 5 of these company-organised webinars was mandatory. We used schedulers on Moodle. Students registered for the webinars of choice, and the registered students received a reminder mail the day of the event with the correct link. So only registered students could participate. We as teachers were also present, and marked the students in the appropriate scheduler as "showed up / attended". Now it is time to give out points, and one of the parameters we need to take into account is how many webinars were attended by each student. So I am looking for a way to export the inf from all schedulers at once into one spreadsheet where I can code filtering + marking based upon attendance. But I cannot seem to find how to do this. In the logs, I can only choose one scheduler and it does not how me the attendance. I can open each scheduler separately and do an export, but that would take ages and then I need to consolidate different spreadsheets by hand into one file. Who can enlighten me on bulk exporting the data contained within different schedulers in one go?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: bulk export of info contained in different schedulers
ResponsesInList.Text: Not sure I fully undestand the case, but how about using Gradebook for that? If you activate grading in the Schedulers, they should all show in the Gradebook, and you should be able to export from the Gradebook all those graded activities you want. Of course, assuming that you have them all in a single Moodle course. Probably not what you want, though, if attendance was not graded in the first place...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: bulk export of info contained in different schedulers
ResponsesInList.Text: I will try to clarify (in writing it takes longer than explaining by word, so my apologies for the long answer) The external partners giving the webinars for which the students registered in the schedulers do not have access to our Moodle, and we do not ask them to grade attendance. It is not the attendance that needs to be graded. It is what students do with the info they receive during these webinars that is graded at the end of the year, based on what the students documented and reported on in their portfolios. A portfolio is a document reporting on all the company-led activities students participated in. And it also contains own research students did after being triggered by new info they glean from these webinars. We as teachers contact companies and see to it that at least once a week, during the entire year there are activities on the workfloor at companies. Due to Covid, this was all replaced with webinars. The Moodle course contains nothing more than schedulers for all of these events. There is a mandatory minimum of webinars the students must attend, but this varies on the type of student (regular day-time students, evening students with a full time job, students with learning difficulties and a less intensive curriculum spread over more years, ...) We as teachers (one course, 5 teachers, 5 different class groups, mix of regular day-time students and working students taking the evening classes) are usually but not always present in ALL the webinars (sometimes we are teaching another group at the same moment when a company decides to organise a webinar that might be of interest to our students or sometimes at the same time there are two companies having hosting different webinars). Day time regular students need to participate in at least 10 webinars over the course of the entire year, working students need to participate in at least 5 webinars. Which webinars are attended, is entirely up to the students. At the end of the academic year (right about now) we as teachers need to check and confirm that these requirements are met, and we need to know which student registered for which event so that we can check if the portfolio they submitted with their reports on each of these webinars is complete and true. Only students that registered in the schedulers received the webinar info. We need the info on which student registered for which webinar in order to grade their portfolios. I would prefer to have the info of ALL schedulers in the course in 1 Excell sheet so that I can open the portfolio of student X, also filter the spreadsheet so that all webinars for which student X registered on Moodle are filtered out and thus check if his/her portfolio is consistent and check if student X met the minimum attendance requirements (different on whether student X is a regular daytime student, a working evening student, or has some hybrid curstom-made curriculum with exceptions to the rules). This would also make it possible to cross-check the report on webinar Y that student X put in their portfolio with the reports of other students that attended webinar Y. Maybe we should have organised it differently in retrospect, but we needed to make changes fast due to ever-changing Covid restrictions. I cannot change the way it was organised now, nor can I integrate with the gradebook after the facts. I counted on the ability of Moodle export functionality. But alas I have come to the conclusion I need to do an export in each of the schedulers separately and then recombine all these different Excell into one master by hand. Unless I am missing something .... Yesterday evening, I developed a curl script containing all the id's and session keys to automatically extract all the spreadsheets of each scheduler separately. I guess today I will be busy combining all these spreadheets together into one master file ....

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: bulk export of info contained in different schedulers
ResponsesInList.Text: Tough indeed, I imagine for each webinar you had multiple dates and times available., so your choice of the tool seemed natural. The Overview tab allows you to pick all the Schedulers in a course, but just for oneself. In any case, the Export function does not listen to the Overview filter , but defaults to "This scheduler". Maybe you could get some success with a proper database query, but it would probably take time to construct ideally. Maybe this tool could help if you wanted to go this way: https://moodle.org/plugins/report_customsql .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: bulk export of info contained in different schedulers
ResponsesInList.Text: At the moment, the only workaround I have been able to setup very quickly is a script using the appropriate curl command syntax to extract the spreadsheets from each scheduler separately. That saves me a ton of clicking around. I obtained the scheduler id-s from the links in the overview of the course. I could just read them from my screen by hovering over the link, and insert them in my script. I had to do 1 manual export and track this using the browser developer tools to obtain the correct session-ID that also needed to go into the curl commands. The plugin you brought to my attention seems extremely usefull. I am quite familiar with SQL statements (especially when I know the table and column names, otherwise al lot of reverse engineering has to be done first). But I am not a Moodle admin. I am a teacher, with only those permissions. I read the documentation, and it seems that I would not only have to convince our admins to install that plugin, but also create new roles with sufficient permissions for teachers to us it within their courses. I don't think I will be able to convince them .... But I'll give it a try anyway Thank you for your time and input!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: bulk export of info contained in different schedulers
ResponsesInList.Text: Tengo el mismo problema ¿sería posible conocer el script?

ResponsesInList.Title: Making booking slots only visible to people in defined group
ResponsesInList.Text: I would like to set up a single activity, but one where when the tutor adds the visible slots, they choose which group the slots are to be visible to. As far as I can tell, if a user is in the same group as the tutor, they see the slots, and if they are not in same group, then they don't see the slots - however, if a tutor is in 2 groups (group A and group B) - if they want to add a series of available slots, only for group A, the only way to do this, is to create a separate item specifically for group A, and use restrictions to restrict access. I have a project with hundreds of different groups, with tutors regularly spanning across multiple groups, so I am going to have to create hundreds of these activities . Is there any way to avoid this?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Making booking slots only visible to people in defined group
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm afraid that slots are always assigned to teachers (and students), not to groups, hence there's no way to restrict them to only one group in Scheduler, apart from restricting the entire activity to a group. However, depending on your situation, it might be useful to divide your groups into groupings , and restrict activities to groupings.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Making booking slots only visible to people in defined group
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Henning for replying and confirming the situation, I will have to stick to duplicating the item and restriction by group. The groupings idea on this occassion won't reduce the number of required items very much, as I would probably end up with about as many groupings as I have groups.

ResponsesInList.Title: Sharing the availability hours
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Can a teacher share the same availabilities slots, created in one course, across other courses? So that the teacher doesn't end up with overlapping time slots from students of different classes. Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sharing the availability hours
ResponsesInList.Text: Scheduler will prevent teachers from making conflicting slots in different schedulers/courses - at least it will try hard to. Try doing this and you should see a "scheduling conflict" message.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sharing the availability hours
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks you. Could a teacher create availability slots and use the same on different courses, instead of creating different availability slots for each course? Thanks again!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sharing the availability hours
ResponsesInList.Text: Unfortunately not; Scheduler is designed as an "activity module" in Moodle terminology, and that means that its data needs to be attached to individual courses (in fact individual instances of Scheduler in a course). If you want teachers to offer slots to students across different courses, I usually recommend to create a " meta course ", i.e., one in which all students are enrolled, and create the Scheduler there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Appointment requests
ResponsesInList.Text: No, that's not possible. The idea behind the plugin is that teachers advertise available slots, which are then booked by students.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Payment per appointment?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Slots shown in Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Beatriz, the calendar events are "user events" i.e. they are attached to individual users, not the course. Hence I don't think it's possible to show all of those in a course. You would need to go to the scheduler instance itself to see a list of all slots (the "Overview" screen in Scheduler might also be of help, although I'm not sure whether it meets your needs). Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler and Moodle 3.11
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear all I, understandably, had a number of inquiries regarding a version of Scheduler for Moodle 3.11, and the current version was tagged as compatible only with Moodle 3.9. Not least because we are migrating our own site to Moodle 3.11 soon, i had a look at the plugin now. As far as I'm aware, the latest release (i.e. 3.7.0) of Scheduler works with Moodle 3.10 and 3.11 as well, up to the following caveats: In Moodle 3.11, with debug messages switched on, you will see some warning messages about a deprecated API (user_picture::fields). These are warning messages only, and can be ignored. (They are fixed on the master branch but not on the MOODLE_37_STABLE branch, as this would make it incompatible with versions before 3.11.) Not all of the automated tests will work (this is always a challenge between Moodle releases); but as far as I can see, the underlying features do work. I have therefore marked Scheduler 3.7.0 as compatible with Moodle 3.10 and 3.11 in the plugins DB. If you find issues with Scheduler in those versions, please do file an issue on the Moodle Tracker , describing details. This is still not a major release of scheduler and has no added features (and some bugs like CONTRIB-8013 are still open). Thanks to everyone who filed bug reports or pull requests; they are not forgotten, even if I haven't gotten round to look at them. I still hope to get to that point soon, but the pandemic has put these plans on hold for some time. The major release will certainly be a 4.x release (with x=0 or x=1 being likely). Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Overview screen - what are "From where", "What", and "What resulted?"
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I hope someone can help. In the Overview screen/tab, there are three fields that are empty, and I don't know where their information is mean to come from. These are the "From where", "What", and "What resulted?" Does anyone know what they are? There is no detail in the relevant part of the Moodle documentation . The final column - 'What happened?' - is populated by the notes made in the part that you access by clicking on the student name in the booked appointments. Thanks, Julian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Overview screen - what are "From where", "What", and "What resulted?"
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Your question made me investigate . What? {what/scheduler} = Comments added to the slot (in the slot settings) = contents of  Comments {comments/scheduler} What resulted? {whatresulted/scheduler} IF you turn on grading in the Scheduler's settings, then Grade info will display in the "What resulted?" column What happened? {whathappened/scheduler} = Notes for appointment (visible to student) (cf. {appointmentnote/scheduler} in the slot settings) But also - if in the Scheduler's activity settings you specify confidential notes for teacher/s only, or both types of notes, then (also) the confidential teacher notes will display in the "What happened?" column (following the for-student notes) cf. the attached screen from the Overview tab: When you view the particular appointment with these details in, it looks like this: I think I would have two suggestions for the Developer based on this analysis (assuming that it's complete): 1) Re-naming the strings in the Overview table in such a way that they correspond to the various settings: "What?" => "Comments (to this slot)" "What resulted?" => "Grade (if activated)" "What happened?" => "Notes for appointment" So as not to confuse "Comments" and "Notes" found in the various places, perhaps "Information about this slot" could be applied in the slot setting and then as the Overview column heading instead of "Comment". Perhaps instead "Grade (if activated)" we could use "Grade for appointment" - since various grading methods may be used in the scheduler, such as use average grade for calculation in the Gradebook  - I have not exactly checked how all this behaves, though. 2) The CSS for for-student notes vs confidential teacher notes should differentiate between these two types of notes (e.g. different color/ font style, or indeed a prefix like: "Visible to student and teacher" vs "Visible to teacher only"). It's possible to customise English (and other) language strings on our Moodles to achieve the above effect but I believe changes in standardising the strings would be useful globally? I also think the posited CSS change cannot be easily done since no css classes are used with these notes in the Overview display - the teacher seems to be forced to remember to include by hand the relevant "prefix" for the confidential notes. Hope this helps. My analysis is NOT based on the latest version of Scheduler but on v. 3.5.1 2018112602 (Moodle 3.6.10)  , but I think much of it should be still accurate enough. Kind regards.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Overview screen - what are "From where", "What", and "What resulted?"
ResponsesInList.Text: PS. The "From Where" column carries any data from the User's full profile > Optional > Department field. Below is a screen from the user's profile edit page: Here's how this info will show on the Scheduler's Overview page:

Regarding grading based on multiple appointments, I just discovered that the problem may be with the display of the calculated mean: - there are no decimal points displayed in the "Total grade" and "Grade in gradebook" cells - although the mean itself IS calculated , BUT - only the integer part of the grade is shown, the decimal points are sliced off, the graded is NOT rounded in any way, as shown below: Perhaps a simple solution would be to adjust the code where this display criteria are set and allow, say, two decimal points, as with most grading defaults in Moodle. If I make further progress, I'll report again. I have recently discovered a similar issue with quiz attempt reviews and percentages . Cheers, Przemek

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Overview screen - what are "From where", "What", and "What resulted?"
ResponsesInList.Text: By tweaking the public function format_grade in /mod/scheduler/renderer.php and commenting line 133 // $grade = ( int) $grade; I was able to force the correct display of the mean grade for both students and teachers opening the Scheduler: Now the value borrowed from the Gradebook would need rounding, which I haven't figured out yet. Likely that this function public function render_scheduler_totalgrade_info might need tweaking - for cases where a numerical grade was sent to Gradebook. I also would not be sure which variable to apply for the decimal points, so for the moment I have stopped exploring further. After all I'm not a programmer ;) . At least the error discovered can be patched with a short edit of one file, or so it seems. Regards. PS. BTW - https://www.php.net/manual/en/language.types.integer.php - this helped me:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Overview screen - what are "From where", "What", and "What resulted?"
ResponsesInList.Text: To correctly render both numbered grades and grading with scales, I have finally settled for the following, I reproduce lines 126 to 150 of the code in renderer.php, and have added bold to my changes: $result = ''; if ($scaleid == 0 || is_null($grade) ) { // Scheduler doesn't allow grading, or no grade entered. if (!$short) { $result = get_string('nograde'); } } else { // $grade = ( int) $grade; // Commented out, or rather moved to l. 143 - PK 2021-05-25 if ($scaleid > 0) { // Numeric grade. $grade = round($grade,2); // Added, PK 2021-05-25 $result .= $grade; if (strlen($grade) > 0) { $result .= '/' . $scaleid; } } else { // Grade on scale. $grade = ( int) $grade; // Added, or rather moved from l. 133 - PK 2021-05-25 if ($grade > 0) { $levels = $this->get_scale_levels(-$scaleid); if (array_key_exists($grade, $levels)) { $result .= $levels[$grade]; } } } This seems to work well, and I  may want to suggest it on the Tracker. HOWEVER -  while comparing what Scheduler claims to be Gradebook's final grade outputs for the Teacher vs the Student , under such condtions: - scales used for grading (e.g. Incompetent-Competent) - mean aggregate selected for grading multiple appointments, then a combination of Competent + Not yet incompetent yields two different overall results :/ : - Not yet competent - on the student's page ( /mod/scheduler/view.php?id=n - the value is taken from the Gradebook here, and I think this IS the correct interpretation) - Competent on the Teacher's page (/mod//scheduler/view.php?what=viewstudent&id=... etc) - this calculation seems to be done within Scheduler, rather than taken from the Gradebook. which I think is understandable, but renders an incorrect result. Anyway. this last discrepancy in aggregation reports seems like another bug to be squashed in Scheduler at some point.

ResponsesInList.Title: Send registered students in a timeslot an automated message
ResponsesInList.Text: Case: Students can register in a timeslot to take part in different webinars. They enroll in advance, when the link / platform on which the webinar will be held is still unknown. One week before the actual event, the scheduler closes. When we get the webinar link from the company that will be doing the guest lecture, we need to get it to the students that have enrolled. Problem: I cannot figure out how to automate this. From the moment we get the webinar link, I would like to stage a message linked to a specific timeslot so that Moodle sends out a message to all enrolled students with the link to the webinar immediately after registration closes. At the moment, I am doing all this manually. I cannot even get Moodle to send out a message to all registered student in a timeslot. It only allow me to send a reminder to students that have not yet registered in a timeslot. But I need to reach the ones that have registered! En preferably automate this. I.e. when i setup the scheduler and the timeslot, setup a message that needs to be sent out to registered students at a moment of my choosing. Any ideas anyone?????

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Send registered students in a timeslot an automated message
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Vaya, this is quite an ordinary scenario and I agree that there must be a way to automatize it. Here is what I would try, but I've never implemented it. Activate the option "Send a reminder", depending on when do you get the meeting link from your customer (I think 24 hours before the meeting is a sensible time window). Edit the Language Strings for mod_scheduler>email_reminder_html. It should somehow include the content of the field/elements comments. This way, you can add the link to the meeting once you get it, and the email reminder which is sent to registered participants would include it. But, as I said, I've never done this and it's just guessing.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Send registered students in a timeslot an automated message

I do not have access to that alas! I do not find my scenario extraordinary in these times of distance teaching. And it will be here to stay. A proper scheduler needs to have a reminder function where the person that created the timeslot can actualy set a message for the reminder. All I can do is activate the option "Send a reminder", but there is nowhere I can type the message that needs to be sent as reminder. That does not make any sense to me. You can only send a preset reminder that cannot be changed without fumbling in .html files that are inaccessible to mere users.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler and Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Scheduler users I have now marked the latest release of Scheduler (3.7.0) as compatible with Moodle 3.9 in the Plugins directory. This is not a new release - it's just to confirm that, according to my tests so far, Scheduler works on Moodle 3.9 just as well as on 3.7 and 3.8. If you saw any imcompatibilities, please report them here or on the Moodle Tracker . I'm still hoping to release a new version with bug fixes and (hopefully) added features later this year, but it will probably be more towards the end of the summer. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler and Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I am fairly new to Moodle and I am trying to figure out how to use the scheduler extension. I have downloaded the zip file but now not sure how to actually access /use it. I apologize if my question doesn't belong here, just trying to navigate my way around. Kind regards, Sandra

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler and Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: You need to unpack the ZIP file's contents into the directory "mod" within your Moodle installation (so that a directory "mod/scheduler" is created). Then, open (your Moodle URL )/admin/index.php in your browser. This is the same for all Moodle plugins - see here: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Installing_plugins#Installing_manually_at_the_server (NB there are other possible methods of installation, as mentioned on the page above.) Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler and Moodle 3.9

ResponsesInList.Title: Some doubts about the notifications system
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I've read the Docs page about the Scheduler and it's very clear but I'd like to confirm if I understood the notification functionalities correctly. I cannot check it by myself because, for policy and security reasons, the email notifications are disabled at my site by now. Here are my assumptions: When a teacher declines (i.e. "revokes") an appointment, only the students who had registered for that specific appointment are notified. When a slot is deleted, no one gets notified. An invitation is sent, by default, to all the participants of the course and not to the students who registered for that slot. To do that, a teacher should select them manually. Could you confirm or correct my assumptions? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some doubts about the notifications system
ResponsesInList.Text:
When
a teacher declines (i.e. "revokes") an appointment, only the students
who had registered for that specific appointment are notified. When a slot is deleted, no one gets notified. These two are correct. An
invitation is sent, by default, to all the participants of the course
and not to the students who registered for that slot. To do that, a
teacher should select them manually. I think that is not quite correct: The invitation or reminder is sent to all students who *did not* yet book a slot. However, the teacher can deselect some of them manually if wanted.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some doubts about the notifications system
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Henning, your explanations are very helpful!

ResponsesInList.Title: Same teacher teaching different courses wanting to use the same office hours across each of his/her courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Friends, Please tell me this is possible! The plugin is kind of useless if I am a teacher with 5 courses, and I want to schedule the same office hours across these courses. Metalinking courses is a bad option for us, as it creates confusion with students by adding yet another course to their list of courses. If a student has 6 courses and sees 6 new meta-courses, it is a recipe for trouble. As a start to making this happen: Can you adapt the plugin where when the teacher sets up a Scheduler activity, that the teacher gets the option - that while creating it in one class - have by default set so that the particular scheduled activity is available for ANYONE with the student role in Moodle? It's not a final option, but it would at least solve the interim problem of having to create metacourses. A future iteration would then include giving the teacher a dropdown list where they could select particular courses for which he/she wants to share the same scheduled activity. What do you think? Paul

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Same teacher teaching different courses wanting to use the same office hours across each of his/her courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Paul Scheduler is (in Moodle parlance) an "activity module" and activities are linked to individual courses. There's no way around this - this is the way Moodle is designed to work. You could use one metacourse where *every* student in your system is enrolled, then you could set up a Scheduler there. Alternatively you might try to add a Scheduler to your Moodle front page , but I must say that this is poorly tested and probably needs some advanced configuration on your side. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Repeated slots occuring once each month?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I'm pretty sure the answer to my question above is no, but I just wanted to ask to experienced users. When adding repeated slots, the standards recurrency is every week, right? In my scenarios, the live sessions with the trainer are scheduled once each month. I'm using Moodle 3.5. Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Repeated slots occuring once each month?
ResponsesInList.Text: That's correct, in fact - there's support for recurring slots every week, but not every month.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Repeated slots occuring once each month?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Henning!

ResponsesInList.Title: Guests can't do anything here.
ResponsesInList.Text: I always get "Guests can't do anything here.", no matter if I put the Scheduler on the front page or part of a course, no matter if I assign teacher and student roles to the Scheduler activity or not. When adding a new Scheduler, it immediately shows "Guests can't do anything here." after I click "Save and display". Is this a bug, or have I missed something? I'm on Moodle 3.8 with Scheduler 3.7.0.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Guests can't do anything here.
ResponsesInList.Text: This error occurs if you don't have the relevant capabilities in the Scheduler activity. In order to see the "teacher side" of the activity, you need to have mod/scheduler:manage or mod/scheduler:attend; in order to see the "student side", you need mod/scheduler:appoint . See here for details: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Scheduler_Module_capabilities (In a standard setup, teachers, students and administrators will have the correct capabilities assigned automatically via their roles, but it may be that you are using customized roles which would need to be updated manually.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Does Scheduler work across more than 1 course?
ResponsesInList.Text: We want to use the Scheduler plug-in to register students from more than 1 course at a time for the same webinar. For example, we want students from Course #1, #2, and #3 to be able to use the scheduler to register together in the same webinar. We want to allow a maximum of 20 reservations for the webinar, so we want the Scheduler to keep track of the total registrations from the multiple courses and stop accepting registrations when it reaches 20. For example, if 10 students from Course #1 and 8 students from Course #2 register, and 2 students from Course #3 register, then the Scheduler will stop accepting reservations. Is this possible?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Does Scheduler work across more than 1 course?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi David, I'd do the following: In one of the courses, I create a hidden section in one of the affected courses and add the scheduler with the availability "Available but not visible to students". Then, in all the courses that need a registration in this specific slot, I create a label with a link to the activity, so that all students are redirected to that scheduler. Cheers!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Does Scheduler work across more than 1 course?
ResponsesInList.Text: Just to add to what Beatriz already said - Scheduler is an activity module and as such can reside in one course only. You'd need a "metacourse" in which all relevant students are enrolled, and then create the Scheduler there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Conflict between "booking in groups" setting  and "Maximum number of sudents per slots"
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, This might seem like a small problem, but it had me baffled for a while. I set up a scheduler for appointments with groups of students, thus using the "booking in groups" parameter. I created the slots, sent the invites. Students came back to me saying that they couldn't book a time slot (not enough place available in the slot, or something to that effect). It took me a while to realize that this is because of the default "maximum number of students per slot" parameter set at "1" by default in the slot creation parameters. So although one student makes the appointment, you need enough "space" in the slot to accomodate all of the students in the group. This is not intuitive (at least for me). A quick solution could be to add that information in the "max number of student per slot"" parameter help bubble, i,e, something to the effect that if you do group  bookings, this parameter should disabled the parameter, or set it to number of students in your biggest groups. Thanks! Best, Eric

ResponsesInList.Title: Missed appointments showing in Upcoming Appointments
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Henning We've noticed that when a student books a slot, doesn't turn up and doesn't get marked as attended then that slot stays listed on their Upcoming Appointments list without a 'cancel booking' button like this... It doesn't make sense that the Upcoming Appointments list should include dates in the past. Is there any way to hide these other than someone going through and manually deleting the missed appointments one by one? (We can write css rules and perhaps do some basic tweaking of php files if needed.) Thanks for any help or ideas you can provide.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missed appointments showing in Upcoming Appointments
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello this is intended - missed appointments need to be cancelled / deleted by the teacher (in order for student to be able to book another slot, depending on your settings). Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missed appointments showing in Upcoming Appointments
ResponsesInList.Text: Shouldn't these be hidden from the student's side though? Or shown somewhere other than Upcoming Appointments? (Or even a note added in the last column saying "This appointment was missed and needs to be re-scheduled by your teacher") Currently, to the student it looks like the system isn't working properly because you've got Upcoming Appointments and then dates listed in the past with no explanation of what that means.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missed appointments showing in Upcoming Appointments
ResponsesInList.Text: The appointments stay in "upcoming" until the student has been marked as attended by a teacher, at which point they will be listed as "attended" slots. Since not all teachers immediately tick the box, I think this is the most consistent way to do it. (The distinction between "upcoming" and "attended" is important in case that a student can book a limited number of slots "at a time"; they can book new slots only once the previous ones have been marked "attended", or indeed deleted.) One could debate whether "Upcoming sessions" is the right word, maybe "Booked sessions" would be better, that would be relatively easy to change via language customization.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missed appointments showing in Upcoming Appointments
ResponsesInList.Text: Okay, I can see what you're saying. We're using the Scheduler for a slightly different purpose than it was designed I think (a series of business workshops where the participants book themselves in not 1-to-1 meetings with a teacher). My fear is that the default setup is great for teachers but confusing for the student because there's not much explanation of what's going on and what they need to do next. Here's the workaround we came up with. If the last cell is empty we use a css hack to add this line of text... For anyone wanting the same you just add this to the CSS in Site Admin > Appearance > Themes > [theme name] > Advanced Settings > Raw SCSS .generaltable:nth-child(7) td.cell.c5:empty::after { content: "This session was missed. Please make sure you've booked a resit."; } .generaltable:nth-child(7) td.cell.c5:empty { text-align: left!important; } Thanks for all the help Henning and for making such a helpful plugin!

ResponsesInList.Title: Temporarily pausing reminder emails?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the awesome work on this plugin Henning. It's been great so far but there's one thing we can't seem to get working. We have a situation where we will book students into 20 appointments before they start a course and then give them the opportunity to cancel/rebook the ones they can't attend themselves. We would like to send them a reminder email when they rebook a slot themselves (on the day that they book it) but we don't want them to each receive 20 email reminders at the start of the course. Is there a way to temporarily pause those reminder emails? I've tried scheduling slots and enabling/disabling the "Email a reminder on..." setting in various combinations/sequences but the reminder email always seem to arrive about an hour later. Any ideas or advice? The person managing this would be semi-technical and could go into the plugin files and temporarily add/remove a line of code when they setup a new course if necessary. Thanks in advance for any help you can offer

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Temporarily pausing reminder emails?
ResponsesInList.Text: Any ideas on this?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Temporarily pausing reminder emails?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello you can stop the reminder e-mails by disabling the relevant "Scheduled Task" in the Moodle administration pages. However, this will work only temporarily. When the task is re-enabled, it will send out the reminders that were missed. (The same happens when you set the "remind by" date to something in the past - Scheduler will notice that the e-mail has not been sent yet, and will send it on the next available occasion.) Sending these reminders is done in mod/scheduler/classes/task/send_reminders.php, that's the place where you would need to edit the code in order to change that behaviour (e.g. suppressing the reminder if the date is too far in the past).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Temporarily pausing reminder emails?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the help on this Henning! In the end we managed to solve this by temporarily turning off the notifications from the plugin in Site administration > notification settings > Reminder of an upcoming appointment. Luckily it doesn't send out the reminders that were missed when we turn the notifications back on so it's a working as required now

ResponsesInList.Title: completion_daily_tasks does not complete
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I have been trying to figure out why "completion_daily_task" is not working/finishing. After many hours of debugging this problem I think I may have found the issue. First I found the problem query: SELECT c.id AS course, u.id AS userid, crc.id AS completionid, ue.timestart AS timeenrolled, ue.timecreated FROM mdl_user u INNER JOIN mdl_user_enrolments ue ON ue.userid = u.id INNER JOIN mdl_enrol e ON e.id = ue.enrolid INNER JOIN mdl_course c ON c.id = e.courseid INNER JOIN mdl_role_assignments ra ON ra.userid = u.id LEFT JOIN mdl_course_completions crc ON crc.course = c.id AND crc.userid = u.id WHERE c.enablecompletion = 1 AND crc.timeenrolled IS NULL AND ue.status = 0 AND e.status = 0 AND u.deleted = 0 AND ue.timestart < ? AND (ue.timeend > ? ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler 3.7.0 released
ResponsesInList.Text:
Dear Scheduler users I have just released Scheduler 3.7.0 on the plugins DB. This release works for Moodle 3.7 and 3.8. Apart from bug fixes and some refactored code, below are the new and changed features. If you are using Scheduler with several teachers in one course, you will in particular want to have a look at the changed permissions model on the teacher side. There is now basic support for the completion API (when using grades) IMPORTANT: Permissions on the teacher side have changed. In particular: Teachers now strictly need the capability
'canseeotherteachersbooking' (or 'manageallappointments') in order to
see the "All appointments" tab. There are new capabilities 'editallgrades', 'editallnotes', and
'editallattended' which allow users without the 'manageallappointments'
capability to edit the grades, the teacher notes, or the attended flag
in all appointments of all teachers, in the appointment screen only. The configuration setting 'allteachersgrading' is no longer in use. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Get Scheduler calendaritems through API

The timetable application synchronizes with the Office365 calendar. When we use the core_calendar_get_calendar_events function we use the parameter courseid to get all the events. Problem is that we are not receiving the Scheduler calendar events with this function. We do get calendar events from other plugins such as Turnitin . Is this a bug or is this default behaviour? Is there another option to get the Schedular calendar events through another Moodle API call?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Get Scheduler calendaritems through API
ResponsesInList.Text: The reason may be that you are looking only for course events - the scheduler appointments are user events, however. Apart from that, they are just usual entires in the Moodle calendar.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Get Scheduler calendaritems through API
ResponsesInList.Text: Do you have any idea how we get these Scheduler user events through the API? We tried the following functions with parameters: Hierbij een aantal verschillende URL 's die we gebruikt hebben: Event by eventid: https://subdomain.domain.nl/webservice/rest/server.php?wstoken=&wsfunction=core_calendar_get_calendar_events&moodlewsrestformat=json&events [eventids][0]=1046 Event by courseid: https://subdomain.domain.nl/webservice/rest/server.php?wstoken=&wsfunction=core_calendar_get_calendar_events&moodlewsrestformat=json&events [courseids][0]=789 Event by categoryid: https://subdomain.domain.nl/webservice/rest/server.php?wstoken=&wsfunction=core_calendar_get_calendar_events&moodlewsrestformat=json&events [categoryids][0]=2&options[timestart]=1574208000

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Get Scheduler calendaritems through API
ResponsesInList.Text: The second one ("Event by courseid:") would do, I think. However, it seems that this returns user events only for the current user (the user that has logged in via the web service token). From a brief look at the code, it seems that that's what the web service is designed to do (the core webservice, not specifically Scheduler) . I didn't find any option to return user events for all users.

ResponsesInList.Text: No, there are currently no reminder e-mails to teachers. I am also not convinced that they would be useful. In a typical scenario, teachers will have quite a number of consecutive time slots, hence a reminder e-mail for each slot (like for students) would not necessarily be helpful. Note that teacher's appointments appear in their Moodle calendar.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Anonymous booking

ResponsesInList.Title: Empty past slots not deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Henning, dear fellow Scheduler users, Since the last 8 days empty past slots have ceased to being deleted. What could be the cause and how can I fix that? Thank you for your answer, Sébastien

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Empty past slots not deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Sebastien, these are deleted by a cronjob (or "scheduled task"). You can check on the Moodle admin pages whether the job has run. Maybe there's something blocking your cronjob?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Empty past slots not deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: You're right, it was simply the cron not working. Thanks for your answer, Sébastien

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Empty past slots not deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Is there any way to set so past slots are not deleted?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Empty past slots not deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: You can disable the corresponding "Scheduled Task".

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course creator's capabilities in Scheduler - needed?
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Przemek Course creators do, by default, have the same permissions in schedulers as editing teachers, only that they cannot "attend students", i.e., they are not supposed to be assigned to time slots. Of course, this is only the default setting. You can configure this to whatever suits you in your installation. Best wishes Henning

Course creators after they create a course for themselves are automatically added as Teachers, so they will acquire everything they need at the course level. Many thanks for any possible concern. Best wishes, Przemek

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler appointments in Timeline?
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Scheduler users Currently, scheduler appointments are shown in a user's calendar but not in the Timeline block (or the timeline of the Course Overview block in Moodle 3.5 and earlier). There's currently a proposal to change that ( CONTRIB-7427 ). If you have any opinion on whether the events should show up in the timeline (for students? for teachers? for everyone?)  then please weigh in, either there ( CONTRIB-7427 ) or in this thread.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler appointments in Timeline?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Henning, I support this improvement. In my opinion, the "Timeline" block is more noticeable than the "Calendar" block, and in the long run would be more popular. Users would get used to see their next events in this area. Think about it this way - The main events that appear in the timeline are due dates of assignments , that are in the end softer than scheduler events. If you miss a due date (which doesn't have a cut-off date, and most don't have in my opinion, at least in my country), it's not optimal but the student can still submit the paper before the teacher actually grade it. However, if you miss a scheduler event, you actually miss a meeting, and someone wasted his time for you. So in that manner, scheduler events are even more important than due dates when thinking about what should appear in the "Timeline" block. Thanks a lot for the great plugin and for thinking about such improvements for it

ResponsesInList.Title: Link Competency with Scheduler activity ("Seen" state)
ResponsesInList.Text: Is it possible to do this? I added competencies to course and then to sheduler, but after mark student as Seen nothing happens in proficient of competencies of this student.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link Competency with Scheduler activity ("Seen" state)
ResponsesInList.Text: Not really, currently. Competencies can be awarded on completion of an activity. However, Scheduler doesn't really define any custom completion events, beyond what works for any graded activity. You could, I think, achieve something similar as follows: set up a scheduler that has a grade scale (possibly just "competent/not competent"); configure the activity to be completed when the student receives a grade; and attach a competency to this completion event.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Error when trying to update a user profile field
ResponsesInList.Text: These are really two different things. The variable $scheduler contains an object of type scheduler_instance. This is different from the record that you retrieve from the database . (See model/scheduler_instance.php for the details.) scheduler_instance contains information about the scheduler, but also about the slots and booked appointments. In order to retrieve the associated database record, you can call the get_data method. E.g.: $record = $scheduler->get_data(); This will actually return a copy of what is in the $data field. It's not how I would normally use that object, though. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Students can register X appointments in this scheduler

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students can register X appointments in this scheduler
ResponsesInList.Text: If you have staff with coding skills around, then this is quite easy to change: The relevant code is in mod/scheduler/mod_form.php near line 61.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Re: Students can register X appointments in this scheduler
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Henning. I located the code and tested it on a local staging site. The change worked perfectly. I will pass on the information to our IT person who will make the changes on the production site. If others would like to know more details, I located the following code in mod_form.php and changed the "<=10" in the code below to "<=12" $maxbookoptions = array(); $maxbookoptions['0'] = get_string('unlimited', 'scheduler'); for ($i = 1; $i <= 10; $i++) { $maxbookoptions[(string)$i] = $i;

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restrict Students from Managing Their Own Bookings

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teacher in charge... is this possible?

If this is set to "no", then those new slots that would create a conflict will not be created. ResponsesInList.Text: Difficult to say from here, but are your "scheduled tasks" running as expected? https://docs.moodle.org/35/en/Scheduled_tasks

ResponsesInList.Title: Múltiple scheduller activities
ResponsesInList.Text: I created 5 scheduller activities with the same slots- same day and hour, but for different courses. Will scheduller syncronize my appointments or these can overlap? Meaning Science year 7 student sets a 7.30 slot, will the slot be blocked to avíos clashing with my appointments from other courses?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Múltiple scheduller activities
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, Scheduler tries to avoid such clashes if they occur for teachers. (I.e. the same teacher cannot have two slots at the same time, even if these occur in different schedulers.) However, for students there is no such conflict checking. https://docs.moodle.org/35/en/Scheduler:_Conflicts Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Send Reminder group list
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I'm hoping I've just missed something rather than this being a new feature request... We've been using scheduler for a few years to manage student adviser meetings. As the student may have contact with the same adviser over several years, we don't want to strip out old scheduler meeting records, so we roll-over the same activity year to year. A few staff contacted me this week as they are prepping the start of new academic session, and report that they have a group of (say 8) students, but the Scheduler is displaying eg "4 students still need to make an appointment - send invitation - send reminder".  The staff want to send a bulk reminder out to their entire student group for the start of the new session, but only some students are listed to contact this way. Is there a simple way to reset this so that it clears the list of who needs to make an appointment so that we can prompt all students to make an appointment each semester or year? I wondered if it was because individual staff hadn't ticked students off as seen after an appointment, but as far as I was aware that only affected students making bookings if it is set to one at a time (ours can make multiple appointments). Thanks, Gordon.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Send Reminder group list
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Gordon, this indeed has to do with students being marked as "attended". I suppose your scheduler is set up to allow only one booking (or a fixed number of bookings) at a time. If a student has made a booking, they will no longer be listed as needing an invite / reminder since they can no longer make a booking. Only once they have been marked as attended, they can actually make another booking (and can be invited/reminded). One option would be that you mark past slots as attended, or delete them if they didn't take place. Another option would be to allow unlimited appointments to students. I hope this makes sense. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Upcoming slots lists past slots
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I noticed that if you've booked a slot, after the slot has already taken place, the slot is still listed under "Upcoming slots." Is there any way that old slots could be listed elsewhere, such as a tab labeled Finished slots? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upcoming slots lists past slots
ResponsesInList.Text: It will be listed under "finished" once the teacher has marked the student as "attended".

ResponsesInList.Title: REST API For Scheduler Module

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: REST API For Scheduler Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Scheduler does not currently offer any web service APIs. The main point is that in our installation, we aren't using them, and I'm not aware of specific requirements from elsewhere to do a meaningful implementation. Maybe the best would be if you add a feature request to the Moodle Tracker (component "Module: Scheduler") so that others can add their vote/opinion.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler 3.5.0 released
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear all somewhat belatedly, I have now released Scheduler 3.5.0 to the Moodle plugins DB. This is tested with Moodle 3.5 and Moodle 3.6 (release candidate). Scheduler 3.5.0 supports Moodle's new Privacy API (for GDPR compliance), including the latest changes of the API for Moodle 3.6 and 3.5.3. (It still seems a moving target.) I'm afraid that there are no other major added features in this relase. I hope to add some improvements for next May/June, time permitting. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Form : Undefined property: stdClass::$modellist
ResponsesInList.Text: I have a form with a selection in it, like this: $mform->addElement('select', 'modellist', get_string('modellist', 'local_plan_animation'), $models); $mform->addRule('modellist', get_string('errorrequired', 'local_plan_animation'), 'required', '', ' server ', false, false); Problem is when i submit the form i have this error: Undefined property: stdClass::$modellist The modellist isn't in the $fromform. I'm kinda confused because it was working before. I modify the 'modellist' with a js to change it's value when an other select element is changed but i don't really know why it would affect the modellist submission since everything seems fine when i look at the html structure when testing. Any ideas?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Form : Undefined property: stdClass::$modellist
ResponsesInList.Text: OK i found out the problem : When you create a select element the value of the option inside of it must be 1, 2, 3... Mine weren't like that and the moodle form didn't appreciate it apparently. EDIT : Well, seems like i was mistaking, this wasn't the problem. The problem is if i chose an option which value is different from 1 it makes the error...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Form : Undefined property: stdClass::$modellist
ResponsesInList.Text: OKOK I found the true real problem this time: When i was creating my select element i was initialising it with 1 option. When i did that the moodle form understood that the select element will never have more than 1 option. So when i submited the form and the option value was 2, the select didn't work because the value shouldn't be more than 1. So i have to create a select element with enough option so it can fit. Hope that helps someone one day

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Certain student(s) not seeing times

ResponsesInList.Title: Limit who can book a class by cohort?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Limit who can book a class by cohort?
ResponsesInList.Text: It's certainly possible to create three different instances of Scheduler and restrict their availability to, say, a group. (There's no restriction to "cohorts" in the Moodle sense, but I assume that's not what you are meaning; if you are technically thinking about cohorts, then one option would be to use cohort enrolment into a course, and assign a group via the cohort enrolment.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Limit who can book a class by cohort?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Henning, Thanks for the reply. I have two requests for possible updates. 1) Could you please make it possible to limit Scheduler access based on cohorts. I'm really looking to be able to do what I stated above. An annoying way around this is to create a separate class for every individual session of the day: morning, afternoon, and evening, which just seems redundant and unnecessary. 2) For the "location" of the meeting, could you make it possible to have clickable hyperlinks? We're looking at doing online classes via some external software such as Zoom, BigBlueButton, or Skype, and this would be tremendously helpful. Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: dmlwriteexception while adding schedule activity
ResponsesInList.Text: For many years I didn't add a new scheduler activty to our moodle, but when I was trying to do this now, I got an error "dmlwriteexception". Anyone can help with this?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: dmlwriteexception while adding schedule activity
ResponsesInList.Text: To answer the question, It would be important to know: What version of Moodle you are using and what version of Scheduler, Which database system you are using, the detailed error message that is displayed when you switch debugging on.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: dmlwriteexception while adding schedule activity
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hello Henning, we are using moodle 3.5 and scheduler 3.3.1 our server is running a mysql database the complete error message is: Debug info: Field 'id' doesn't have a default value INSERT
INTO mdl_scheduler
(name,staffrolename,maxbookings,schedulermode,bookingrouping,guardtime,defaultslotduration,allownotifications,usenotes,usebookingform,usestudentnotes,uploadmaxfiles,requireupload,course,intro,introformat,timemodified,scale)
VALUES(?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?) [array ( 0 => 'asdfasdf', 1 => '', 2 => '1', 3 => 'oneonly', 4 => '-1', 5 => 0, Stack trace: line 489 of /lib/dml/moodle_database.php: dml_write_exception thrown line 1300 of /lib/dml/my sql i_native_moodle_database.php: call to moodle_database->query_end() line 1346 of /lib/dml/mysqli_native_moodle_database.php: call to mysqli_native_moodle_database->insert_record_raw() line 46 of /mod/scheduler/lib.php: call to mysqli_native_moodle_database->insert_record() line 124 of /course/modlib.php: call to scheduler_add_instance() line 154 of /course/modedit.php: call to add_moduleinfo()

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: dmlwriteexception while adding schedule activity
ResponsesInList.Text:
This sounds like a configuration problem of the database (schema), although I'm not quite sure why this would have changed from the default. Can you run the following query on your database? `describe mdl_scheduler id;` The expected output is: 
```text
# Field, Type, Null, Key, Default, Extra


'id', 'bigint(10)', 'NO', 'PRI', NULL, 'auto_increment'
```
 The "auto_increment" bit is what I suspect might be different in your DB.

ResponsesInList.Title: How do I password protect repeated slots in the schedule?
ResponsesInList.Text: My moodle version is 2.8. I'm wondering how I can password protect repeated slots in the schedule so that only people with a password can select a specific slot?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How do I password protect repeated slots in the schedule?
ResponsesInList.Text: Moving to Scheduler forum...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How do I password protect repeated slots in the schedule?
ResponsesInList.Text: There is no such password feature in Scheduler. What you could do is to limit access to the entire Scheduler via access restriction to the activity.

ResponsesInList.Title: How do I allow people to view a schedule without being allowed to select a date? (Moodle 2.8)
ResponsesInList.Text: How my moodle is formatted is that people must pay before they can select a date on the schedule. However, I would like to include an option for students to view that same schedule before paying. How can I do this? My version of Moodle is 2.8.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How do I allow people to view a schedule without being allowed to select a date? (Moodle 2.8)
ResponsesInList.Text: Moving to Scheduler...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How do I allow people to view a schedule without being allowed to select a date? (Moodle 2.8)
ResponsesInList.Text: For users to view the slots, but not be able to book them, the users would need to have the capability "mod/scheduler:viewslots" but not "mod/scheduler: appoint". See here for details. (Note: this is available from Scheduler 3.1 on, but not in earlier versions.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Two questions: 1) simultaneous classtimes 2) location
ResponsesInList.Text: 1) Let's say I have two classrooms: Mathematics English Why can't I have individual instances of the scheduler plugin with overlapping timetables? Like, an English class on Friday at 9 am and a math class on Friday at 9 am? 2) For the location slot, is it possible to use a hyperlink?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Two questions: 1) simultaneous classtimes 2) location
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe this is possible. When you are setting up the time slot there is a location for ignoring scheduling conflicts. I am using 3.2 so I don't know if that is still available in your version. But if you select that box then the system will ignore the scheduling conflicts.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Two questions: 1) simultaneous classtimes 2) location
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the reply, Scott. I looked in to this, and it looks like the ignore scheduling conflicts feature only shows up for individual classes. If you create a chain of timeslots simultaneously, the only similar option is Force when overlap, which just deletes other courses running during the same time. Anyway, I realized what the main problem was. Schedule is really based on what teacher is teaching the course. As I was testing the plugin, I had the same teacher set to multiple slots in different classes.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Two questions: 1) simultaneous classtimes 2) location
ResponsesInList.Text: This is correct. Scheduler tries to prevent conflicts in the calendar of each teacher, even across different instances of Scheduler. N.B. the location field can't take formatting or hyperlinks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Restrict access to confidential notes
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I'm looking for a way to prevent staff with the non-editing teacher role from seeing confidential notes written by other staff in a scheduler activity. Is it sufficient to modify the permission See and browse other teachers booking to set it to prohibited or are there other changes that need to be made - and is there any knock-on effect of changing this that I should be aware of? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restrict access to confidential notes
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, that is the way to go. However, I think you should test it carefully to see whether that solution meets your needs - for example, by "logging in as" relevant non-editing teachers and see what they can see.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler 3.3.1 maintenance release, and Moodle 3.5 plans
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Scheduler users Scheduler 3.3.1 has just been released. It doesn't contain new features, but is purely a bugfix release for Scheduler 3.3.0. It will work on Moodle 3.3, 3.4 and the upcoming 3.5. I'm planning to finish work on Scheduler 3.5 (which will support Moodle 3.5 onwards) over the next two months. This will include new features (details TBA) and in particular support for the new Privacy API . Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for maintaining the scheduler into 3.5 Henning, it's a plugin we use extensively at my school. I was wondering if there were any plans to implement importing csv data into scheduler as per https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-5533 ? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Text: It's happening in all of them, as an admin it's not something I regularly use but an academic reported it to me the other day and I tested a range of Schedulers with the same result, so I can't actually tell how long it's been happening.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: manual export - invalid user
ResponsesInList.Text: Right... If this is on a test environment, any chance that you could turn debugging on? (Site administration -> Development -> Debugging; set "Debug Messages" to "Developer" and "Display debug messages" to "Yes".) This should result in a more detailed error message.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: manual export - invalid user
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, unfortunately this isn't a test system, nevertheless I've turned debugging on and got an error (attached) that may be more helpful in figuring out what is happening, obviously turned it off again just now, but if you nee me to look at any other sections (with debugging or not) let me know Thanks Derek

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: manual export - invalid user
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks a lot, that's very helpful. As far as i could find out: The problem is triggered by a custom profile field that you have on your system, likely set to visible only to admins. The problem likely exists only in the very latest version of Scheduler (3.3.1), related to my fix for CONTRIB-7296 , and only in Moodle 3.3, not 3.4 and later. My suspicion is that this is actually a bug in the Moodle Core API, it occurs when I ask whether a profile is visible but outside the context of a particular user. I will work on it, but if it's in Moodle Core, this may take a while. If you need an immediate fix and know how to perform this, you can revert the following change in your local installation: https://github.com/bostelm/moodle-mod_scheduler/commit/2a06a9224aa6ed0c79946bc26fc0518df3255a09 Best wishes Henning

I created the role based on authenticated user, I could try creating it based on another archetype if that would be useful. I'm going to temporarily remove the role just now to see if that solves it, I'll let you know more Thanks Derek
