ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feature: revoke single student
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Andriy I would not want to overload an already full teacher screen with even more buttons. Hence my initial thought was, in these cases, you could simply click the "Edit slot" button, and remove the individual student appointments that are no longer required. However, you say that this has not worked for you, giving you an error " You can't start an empty appointment slot in the past ", is that correct? This seems like a bug to me. However, I tried to reproduce it on the latest version of Scheduler, and for me everything seemed to work out fine. You can tick the " Delete this appointment (when saving the form) " checkbox for one student (or more), and the appointment will in fact be deleted. The error message is shown only when you try to delete *all* appointments in the slot, thus leaving it empty, but i understand that that's not the case you're asking about. Hence the problem might have to do with the Scheduler version you are using. The edit screen has changed several times, and the method I described above should work from Scheduler 3.3.0 on. Possibly you're using an older version - which is it? Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Show all booked slots to all students

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler not exporting events to Moodle's calendar feed? (after upgrade to 3.3)
ResponsesInList.Text: The problem is still not fixed in Moodle Core ( MDL-58768 ) - any user-related events are currently missed out.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler not exporting events to Moodle's calendar feed? (after upgrade to 3.3)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Sebatien (and all) it turns out that this behaviour is (at least partially?) caused by a bug in Moodle Core: In Moodle 3.3, user events are missing from the export when the user is not currently logged in (in particular when Google, or another calendar client, fetches the ical export). See MDL-60213 and linked issues. Note that the complete export will be shown when you are logged into Moodle via a browser and download the export from there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler not exporting events to Moodle's calendar feed? (after upgrade to 3.3)

ResponsesInList.Title: Conflict Issues - Room Booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I am attempting to use the Scheduler as a Room Booking activity. I was looking to use a separate scheduler per room. However because I am setting the same teacher as the booking admin for all rooms this is causing conflicts with available slots. Would there be any future plans to permit removing all conflicts that would allow for the activity to be used in this manner. Or are there any simple changes that can be made to the code that would allow the same process be carried out. Many thanks, Joe

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Conflict Issues - Room Booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Scheduler is really designed for booking appointments with teachers (not rooms), hence the conflict checks. If you would like to change this in your installation, then i think that editing the function scheduler_instance->get_conflicts(), so that it always returns an empty array, should do the trick. (This is in mod/scheduler/model/scheduler_instance.php .) I'm not sure whether this makes sense as a built-in option though. It would be quite easy to include a global option (conflict detection yes or no, for all schedulers), but is this what users want? If this is supposed to be an option on a per-scheduler basis, it becomes more tricky to implement I guess.

ResponsesInList.Title: Change teacher
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi, We've had an issue where a staff user was originally enroled on a module with an old account. The
scheduler was setup and slots allocated to that account. That
user was subsequently unenroled and the new account enrolled on the module. Scheduler is still referencing the original account and sending email notifications to the old email address. Is there a way to change the teacher on a scheduler without doing this slot-by-slot? We're on Moodle 3.2. Thanks Olivia

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Change teacher
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Olivia I know my reply is a little late, but let me answer for future reference. There's no feature in the interface that lets you "bulk change" the teacher in appointments. You might do this if you have someone around with the knowledge to access the database directly - here it's the table scheduler_slots and the field teacherid that needs changing. ResponsesInList.Title: Schedule appointments with non-students

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Schedule appointments with non-students
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Scheduler can be configured in this respect via capabilities . By default, students have the capability "mod/scheduler:appoint" (which allows them to book appointments) and teachers have the capability "mod/scheduler:manage" (which allows them to set up slots) but you could assign this to any other role. What does not work well is people having both the capabilities to set up slots and to book slots. Guests will not be able to book slots, as the slots need to be associated with a user.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teachers can decide their own schedule. Students pick from a poll of Teachers
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dan, in Scheduler, each slot is always assigned to exactly one teacher. Each teachers can set up their own slots (and choose the corresponding times) - this works just as well if you have several teachers on the course. Students can then choose one of the available slots from any teacher (unless group restrictions are in place). Different teachers might choose to offer slots at the same time, these will then be displayed to the student as separate slots (not as one slot) which they can choose from. Best wishes Henning

But when he fills the same form in another course, he has an error "Can not find data record in database table scheduler_slots". ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Cannot add same repeated slots in different courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Mikhail, > He understands that he can have two same meetings without a problem No, that's not quite correct. In fact, Scheduler will try to prevent such "conflicts" in the calendar. What happens (or should happen) if you create the second slot series, and set "Force when overlap" to "Yes", is that the first slot series gets deleted. It seems however, by your report, that there's some problem in the deletion process. Have you tried this in a newer version of Scheduler? Both Moodle 2.7.9 and Scheduler 2.7.2 are now out of maintenance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Issue with Scheduler links to grading in Moodle 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Henning, First thanks for a very useful plugin that has been really helpful for us with booking E-Learning webinars with a global group of E-Learners. Then on to the issue we encountered which caused us some problems last week.  When updating an instance of the scheduler we found that while we made no changes to grade settings the grading disappeared. I did some tests and diagnostics which may help identify the cause. However, first it is worth noting how we use the scheduler as this may be why we have noticed this when others have not. We use a course for multiple intakes. Each course has several scheduler instances for interactive webinar booking.  We add slots for each intake. We grade students for webinar participation. The sum of webinar grades must be above a certain percentage for course completion. Recently we changed the platform used for the interactive webinars ... so we altered the description to add the new details. After this we found in some cases the grades were no longer showing. We were able to restore the grades but as part of looking into it became aware there were some perfectly reasonable actions that were causing the underlying grading problem to recur. When I looked in more detail, I discovered this is due to an issue with the user interface for editing the Scheduler text. The following sequence of actions demonstrated this: Cycle 1 Select "Edit settings" for a Scheduler instance Set Grade type as "Point" and Maximum Grade as "2" (for example) Save and display NOTE: Previously entered grades are shown as expected Cycle 2 Select "Edit settings" again NOTE: The Grade and Maximum Grade are set as expected. Set Grade Category as  "Webinars" (a category in the gradebook) Save and display NOTE: Previously entered grades are NOT shown Cycle 3 Select "Edit settings" again NOTE: The Grade and Maximum Grade are shown as NOT set. Repeat steps from Cycle 1 above … this corrects and restores the grades The way we fixed this was to use the Gradebook editor to reassert the link to the Category rather than doing this through the scheduler editing form. In this case the problem did not occur. However, it was still reproducible if we edited the grade through the Scheduler edit for the link to the Category was broken. I appears that what is happening is that when the Scheduler for is used to updated the grade category, the link to the grader item is lost. Also I notice the Ubuntu logfile shows the following error message when this incident occurs. I am not sure if this is connected. PHP Notice:  Undefined property: stdClass::$ requiremodintro in /var/www/html/moodle/course/moodleform_mod.php on line 894, referer: https://elearning.ihtsdotools.org/course/modedit.php?update=1298&return=1 Apologies for the long posting ... it would be great if this is something that can be fixed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with Scheduler links to grading in Moodle 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear David Thanks for the detailed description. I was able to reproduce the problem, but currently I'm not sure of the reason. I have put the issue on the tracker ( CONTRIB-6893 ), feel free to comment there. I'll update the entry there when the problem is resolved. The message in the logfile is likely unrelated. It points towards a global configuration setting that is not properly initialized. You can probably resolve this by navigating (as admin) to Site admininstration -> Notifications and following the screens there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with Scheduler links to grading in Moodle 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe this is now fixed. You can download the corrected version from github; the fix will also be included in the next maintenance release.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with Scheduler links to grading in Moodle 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Many Thanks Henning, I am delighted to confirm that the patch to mod_form.php fixed the issue I report. Really pleased by such a quick turn-round. Thanks for your work on this really useful plugin!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Seats limit overstepped in appointment slots
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, in your version the bug is fixed (at least the one I know of). But perhaps you've found a new bug? If you manage to reproduce the problem, let me know. Also, it would be interesting to know how much time elapsed between the last bookings on these slots. In the Moodle logs, you can find an event every time that a student makes a booking (event scheduler\booking_added). Perhaps you can find the bookings of those students that last booked into the overfull slots. Are they minutes, seconds, or maybe milliseconds apart?  (That would indicate whether it's a problem in the software, or maybe a synchronization problem in your particular setup.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Student-provided data (New feature, under development)
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Scheduler users currently, the most frequently requested feature for Scheduler is, by some length, the ability for students to provide data (text, files, etc.) in advance of their appointment. (See CONTRIB-5343 and linked issues.) I have now started to implement such a feature and would like to share it with you early, so that  I can get an idea whether the solution actually meets the need. The rough idea would is that, if so configured by the teacher, students see one text box and one file upload field at time of booking. The text box can be used for various purposes - the teacher can specify in a "booking instructions" text what is actually requested. While I was at it, I also added the option to show a CAPTCHA at booking time. I add a few screenshots below, which should give an idea of the new feature as currently planned. The very adventurous can also install it on their test system - see the branch "bookingdata" on github - however, please note that this is a work in progress and that I don't guarantee that any data can be carried forward to the final version at all! Please use it on a test system only Feedback is welcome - please just reply to this post. I'm planning to release the feature at approximately the time of Moodle 3.3, and it will likely be compatible with that version only. Best wishes Henning Here's the new section of the configuration screen (Scheduler settings): A student will first see the usual list of slots, with a "Book slot" button: Clicking on "Book slot", they are presented with a booking form that allows them to enter text / upload files: The teacher sees a "paperclip" icon next to the student's booking, indicating that data has been provided: Opening the relevant appointment (by clicking on the student's name), the teacher can access the student-provided data:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler confirmation of appointment to student

ResponsesInList.Title: Completion Settings
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Henning, Thanks for maintaining this great plugin. I have a suggestion for future versions that may be helpful for users (as well as myself of course!): In the completion settings, allowing the activity to be marked as complete when a student has made a booking, has been marked as seen etc. Thanks, Catherine

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Completion Settings
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Catherine, thanks for that suggestion. Actually, there is an existing feature request ( CONTRIB-4958 ) which asks for essentially this; you may want to vote/comment there. For me, the main point is that I'm not sure what exactly users would want in this respect. In our own installation, we don't use activity completion. It's not clear to me (a) how many Scheduler users would actually need this feature, and (b) what exactly would typically mean that a student has "completed" the scheduler. You name some alternatives and one could certainly come up with more, but what would actually be useful in practice? In particular, what about schedulers that allow more than one booking, that allow an unlimited number of bookings per student, etc.? If you (or anyone else in this forum) has suggestions, please do comment here or on the Moodle Tracker (ticket linked above).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Completion Settings
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Henning for your response.  I'll add to the tracker. So a scenario that I would use it for: Say I need students to book in an appointment. When a student has booked themselves in for a slot they have 'completed' the activity. This opens up quite a few possibilities e.g. It allows me to then target students who have not completed it (booked an appointment) by sending out an automated reminder email through the re-engagement plugin. Or I can send out an automated email to users who have completed it with information that they need for the meeting or class. It allows me to download a spreadsheet showing who has and hasn't completed the scheduler activity by looking at the Activity Completion report. It also allows me to restrict access to other activities on the page e.g. I don't allow students to be able to view a certain document until they have booked an appointment. Another useful completion criterion could be that the activity is 'complete' when a student has been marked as seen. Thanks, Catherine

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Calendar event template
ResponsesInList.Text: To achieve this, you would need to modify the code. I think the method scheduler_slot->update_calendar() is what you would need to look at, in the file mod/scheduler/model/scheduler_slot.php .

ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the reply, I am sure anyone with little php knowledge could do it , but I have no experience in php, I tried to read the code and analyse the function that assembles the event object with no luck. I appreciate if you can provide any further help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Calendar event template
ResponsesInList.Text: I think the best way to achieve this would be to modify the following lines: foreach ($students as $student) { $studentnames[] = fullname($student); } Here "fullname($student)" should be replaced with: fullname($student).' ['.$student->id.']' However, you should really only modify the code if you have the experience to do so.

Thank you again for this amazing plugin and committed support. -Wasim

ResponsesInList.Title: Intention to remove capability "mod/scheduler:disengage"
ResponsesInList.Text: Currently, Scheduler has a capability setting "mod/scheduler:disengage" which controls whether students can drop their appointments. By default, all students have this capability and they see a button "Drop my appointments" in the booking screen. However, admins can change the configuration and remove this capability from students (I'm not sure how often they do that in practice). In that case, students can't drop their appointments once they've booked a slot. They can only change their booking, dropping one appointment and booking another one at the same time. This seemed to make sense when students were only allowed to book one slot at a time. But since Scheduler 2.7, students can be allowed to make more than one booking, and then the concept of "changing the booking" is more complex (and in fact Scheduler will always allow students to drop their appointments in this configuration). With further feature requests (e.g., paging in student view, CONTRIB-5194 ), things will become even more complicated in this respect - which makes me wonder whether the feature to deny students "dropping" (rather than changing) their appointments is really worthwhile. In other words, I'm planning to remove the setting in future versions. Students would then always be allowed to drop their appointments, unless the appointments are within the "guard time". However, if you still require this feature, please reply here, and explain why you think it's required. Thanks Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Intention to remove capability "mod/scheduler:disengage"
ResponsesInList.Text: This seems like a reasonable thing to do.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Intention to remove capability "mod/scheduler:disengage"
ResponsesInList.Text: Just to say that this change has now landed in the master branch. Any student who is allowed to book a slot can now also cancel the booking, subject to time restrictions (in particular the Guard Time setting).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Intention to remove capability "mod/scheduler:disengage"
ResponsesInList.Text: A teacher has asked me how he can set up his scheduler so as to deny students cancelling a booking. I tried changing permissions in the activity for the student role, with no effect.  I Googled the problem and landed on this forum page. If I understand correctly, students can now cancel at any time, regardless of activity permissions?  Are there any workarounds to this behavior?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Intention to remove capability "mod/scheduler:disengage"
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Marc, students can cancel their booking, regardless of permissions. However, they cannot do so "at any time". In the Scheduler settings page, you can configure a "guard time". If this is set to, say, 4 hours, then students can cancel (or change) their booking only until 4 hours before their slot begins.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Intention to remove capability "mod/scheduler:disengage"
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the reply.  Unfortunately, that option doesn't work for our needs, we want to be able to block cancellations completely .  I guess we'll have to look elsewhere.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler 2.9.0 released
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Scheduler users Scheduler 2.9.0 has now been released on the plugins DB. This release is intended for Moodle 2.9 and for the upcoming Moodle 3.0. The most important difference to previous versions in the change in group handling ( see here ). Scheduler now distinguishes between "Scheduling in groups" (i.e., a student can book their entire group into a slot), and the more standard Moodle "Group mode" ("Visible groups" etc.) The effect of setting the "group mode" is now that students can book slots only with teachers that are members of their own groups. This is a major change from Scheduler 2.7; data will be converted accordingly when you install the update, but if you have used "group scheduling" before, it may be a good idea to check your data carefully on a test system before upgrading your live system. Other changes include a much improved export feature, and a redesigned student screen. Note that Scheduler 2.7 works on Moodle 2.9 as well and you can continue to use it, but I would encourage users to upgrade to the new 2.9 branch of Scheduler (MOODLE_29_STABLE on github). We've been working with Scheduler 2.9 on our own installation for a few weeks, and it seems to be working fine; but if you find any problems, please do let me know, preferably by posting a ticket on the Moodle Tracker . Best wishes

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler 2.9.0 released
ResponsesInList.Text: Scott, You can change the prompts that Scheduler (or any moodle module) displays using Language customisation . Basically, what you would do is to fire up the Language customisation tool (under Site administration > Language > Language customization) , select 'scheduler.php' and then scroll down to change strings that have the word 'Teacher' in them. Obviously to do this, you'll need to login as the system administrator (or have him/her login for you). I would suggest trying out the process on a sandbox moodle site first so that you can familiarise yourself and get the correct text to appear where you need it to appear. But do start with reading through the documentation linked above. Cheers! Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: Create one schedule for multiple courses
ResponsesInList.Text: I have tried in vain to create one schedule in a metacourse which would show the same timeslots in the child course. The idea is that a teacher can provide their available times once, and students from multiple courses can select from this parent schedule. However, it doesn't seem to work. The Meta course does not populate other schedules in other courses. Any ideas? Thanks, Tony

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create one schedule for multiple courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello slots are always local to the scheduler that they're created in, and the scheduler is local to the course in which it sits. Slots will not be "propagated" to other schedulers. This is due to the way that Moodle activities work. The data is always attached to a "course module", and the "course module" to a course. Anything else would badly break Moodle's core mechanisms (for example, access control or backup/restore). Instead, you may want to create a *link* from individual courses to (the scheduler in) your Metacourse.

ResponsesInList.Title: export - access for multiple users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I have create an new date for a appointment. As creator i can export data to a csv file. I need that someone else could also export data but for the moment i can't find the correct access to give. The preview is still empty. Could you help me... Kind regards Bertrand

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: export - access for multiple users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Bertrand the person exporting the appointments needs to have the " mod/scheduler:canseeotherteachersbooking " capability. Editing teachers, course creators, and managers normally have this capability. Also, make sure that in the export screen, the "Include slots for" box is set to "everyone". Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: export - access for multiple users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Henning, I've change my user access, i'm in the group manager. But my user still doesn't have the right access. I don't understand why Regards Bertrand

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: export - access for multiple users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Bertrand as you say (and as visible from the screenshot), you do not have the "mod/scheduler:canseeotherteachersbooking" capability. This is likely to do with the configuration of roles on your system. My guess is that for one of your roles (possibly "Editeur pour l'epfc" which seems to be a customized role?), the assignment for "mod/scheduler:canseeotherteachersbooking" is set to "prohibit". This would prevent you from having the capability regardless of other roles possibly allowing it. You should best revisit your role configuration ( Administration > Site administration > Users > Permissions > Define roles ) and there, for every one of the three relevant roles ("Manager", "Editeur pour l'epfc", "Authenticated user"), check what the status of "mod/scheduler:canseeotherteachersbooking" is. Be sure to click "Show advanced", the screen should look like this . My guess is that the correct setting would be "Allow", "Allow" and "Not set" respectively, but it very much depends on your intended Moodle setup. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: export - access for multiple users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Henning, You're right, The capability for the "Authenticated user" was set to prohibit. Thanks a lot Bertrand

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduling conflicts
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear all Scheduler has, for a long time now, had a feature that prevents "scheduling conflicts" in some situations. In particular, teachers are warned if they are about to create a slot that overlaps with one of their other slots, in the same scheduler or elsewhere. There is no such warning for students however. Over time, I have received a number of comments regarding this feature; some were confused about how it works, and others asked for it to be changed or expanded. For the upcoming release of Scheduler 3.1, I have reviewed the "scheduling conflicts" feature, slightly altering how it behaves (with the intent of cleaning it up); and in particular, I have documented the current behavior: https://docs.moodle.org/31/en/Scheduler:_Conflicts I'd be happy to receive any comments on whether this feature is useful in the current form or should be changed. It's mostly a trade-off, I think, between being helpful to the users (through stricter consistency checks) and annoying them (by blocking them from legitimate use cases). Best wishes

ResponsesInList.Title: Allowing students to schedule without enrolling
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all. In order to facilitate peer tutoring, I've created a "course" in every category (categories include physics, chemistry, geometry, etc) called "Tutors" in which all students are assigned the role of teacher (which I've renamed "Peer tutor") so that they, if they wish, can create a Scheduler activity of their own. That way, students who want to be peer tutors in a specific course category can offer time slots to other students seeking help. I don't want the students in search of peer tutoring to have to enroll in this "course" just to schedule a time slot with a peer tutor, though. Thus, I would like anyone logged into my Moodle site but not enrolled in the Tutors "course" to be able to click on any student's Scheduler activity and be able to book a time. I have enabled guest access to the "course" to accomplish this, but when a student clicks on any student's Scheduler activity link, the following message appears: "Guests can't do anything here." Is it possible to allow users logged into Moodle but not enrolled in the "course" in which Scheduler activities are listed to actually book time slots? PS - You can visualize what I’m trying to replicate by looking at the first screen in this video: That’s not my video; I’m just trying to replicate the idea of a “course” in which all tutors are listed on the same page and students can click to book time with any of them.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Allowing students to schedule without enrolling
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Albert I'm afraid you're on uncharted territory here. First, Scheduler was really designed to allow enrolled students in a course to book slots, and enrolled teachers to offer slots. It *may* allow non-enrolled users to do something, but that is more a bug then a feature ( CONTRIB-6244 ). Also, Scheduler assumes that a user is either a student (with capability mod/scheduler:appoint) or a teacher (with capability mod/scheduler:attend). Depending on that, the user will either see the student screen or the teacher screen. Users can't have both. For a scheduler that everyone can use, I normally place it on the front page (but in the usual student/teacher setup). Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Allowing students to schedule without enrolling
ResponsesInList.Text: I have created the timetable on the main page of my website. This way every authorized user is able to schedule a time slot without any enrollment to any course. You create a course and place there the link to the timetable, which is binded to the main page, not to the course itself. I am new in web programming and not sure, that it is exactly what you want, I hope my advice would work out. Try it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Deleting student slot notification
ResponsesInList.Text: Would scheduler send a notification to student if the teacher deletes his/her appointment slot? Also, when you have multi teachers, can you create repeated slots for all teachers at the same time with the same period? Or do you need to repeat it for each? Sometimes you have for example a speaking test and you have four teachers and want to create slots for all teachers at the same time. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deleting student slot notification
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello > Would scheduler send a notification to student if the teacher deletes his/her appointment slot? No, if the teacher deletes a slot ("red cross" button), then no notification is sent. However, if the teacher cancels an appointment ("thumb down" button), then a notification is sent to the student. (For that to happen, the "Notifications" setting needs to be turned on in the relevant scheduler settings.) > Also, when you have multi teachers, can you create repeated slots for all teachers at the same time with the same period? No. You would need to repeat these steps for every teacher.

ResponsesInList.Title: Add Location to Slot Manager
ResponsesInList.Text: Good Day I was hoping to find out if it is possible to add the location of an event within the slot manager. I had no problem editing the code to get the dates to all display even though its duplicated, as well as adding the header for location, but i can't seem  to get the locations to populate. format_string($slot->location); is blank so i assume  that the variable passed to the public function render_scheduler_slot_manager(scheduler_slot_manager $slotman) function does not include the location data. $this->render($slot->students); just returns something about trying to render a null value in the renderable function which just adds to my thoughts on location data not being in the $slotman variable. I've been messing about in renderer.php and nowhere else. Is there anyway for me to edit / change the data in that variable, or is there another way to get the location data? Regards, Izak

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add Location to Slot Manager
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Izak Have a look at scheduler_slot_manager->add_slot() in renderable.php. The data to be displayed later is stored into the scheduler_slot_manager object at that point, and here you would need to add the location information. You can then use it within render_scheduler_slot_manager(). Hope that helps Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add Location to Slot Manager
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Henning It worked perfectly. All i needed to do was add $slot->location = $slotmodel->appointmentlocation; to the add_slot() function as you mentioned above and then had it populate to the table with $rowdata[] = format_string($slot->location); in the render_scheduler_slot_manager(scheduler_slot_manager $slotman) function. Thanks for pointing me in the right direction. It looks great now. Kind Regards, Izak

ResponsesInList.Title: NGP in scheduler
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello I have the following problem. I am using the scheduler and students can receive a mark for their appointment, using a non graded pass scale. The tool is set that students can only book one appointment. However, when I am awarding a fail or re-attempt, they should be able to book another session. This, however, does not seem to work. any ideas? Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: NGP in scheduler
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello no, Scheduler doesn't currently do this (and was never designed to do so). If you set the scheduler to allow "only one appointment", then it allows exactly this - one booking per student. One option might be to switch to "one appointment at a time". Of course, then in principle every student could book another appointment once you have marked them as "seen"; I'm not sure whether that matters in your case. Another workaround is to delete the previous appointment of the student, which will allow them to book another one.

ResponsesInList.Title: Copying scheduler
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello We are trying to use the scheduler tool to book laboratory sessions. For this, I have populated a scheduler with a few sessions, and would like to do multiple copies, however all copies are empty, i.e. the slots are not copied over. Any ideas?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Copying scheduler
ResponsesInList.Text: I guess you are using the "duplicate" button to create the copies. This will (whatever the activity) create a copy "without user data". For an assignment, for example, that means a copy without the user's submissions and grades. For a scheduler, it means a copy without the slots. In both cases, that's normally what you want. (Also, a copy of the slots would mean creating conflicting slots between the schedulers.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Appointments Appear in Upcoming Events Block for All Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I'm looking for some guidance/feedback on this behavior I've observed.  Scenario:  I create a Scheduler activity in Course A, and a student requests an appointment in a slot.  Then I see that appointment showing up in the "Upcoming Events" block not only within Course A, but within every other course I have: Course B, Course C, etc...  I've come to learn that the "Upcoming Events" block within a course is only supposed to show upcoming events for items within THAT course  but that doesn't seem to be the case for the Scheduler activity. Is anyone else experiencing this behavior?  Is it by design?  If not, I'm considering reporting it as a bug. Thanks Joe

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Appointments Appear in Upcoming Events Block for All Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: This is due to the design of the Moodle calendar system. In Moodle, there are four types of calendar events: Site events, course events, group events, and personal events. The Scheduler appointments need to be personal events, since they relate to individual people only, not to all participants of the course, group, etc. However, personal events cannot be filtered by course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Appointment notification emails
ResponsesInList.Text: When an appointment is made with a teacher the scheduler emails that's teacher to let them know that an appointment has been made.  Would it be possible to include the option to also notify another teacher? My scenario is this:  We have appointments that can been booked with our careers manager through scheduler and these notifications need to be sent to him, but we also need to send them to our careers administrator as she also makes appointments for him if students go to the careers office to make an appointment.  Is there any way that this can be done? Many thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Appointment notification emails
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm sorry, but Scheduler currently sends these notification e-mails only to one person: the teacher that "owns" the slot. A workaround, outside Moodle, would be if the careers manager sets up an e-mail forwarding rule, filtering e.g. on the subject of the e-mail, that forwards the notifications to the administrator. This would clearly depend on your e-mail system/client, but e.g. in Gmail it would work, I think.

ResponsesInList.Title: Overlapping time slots for a teacher in 2 courses

Please advise on how to handle this situation.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Overlapping time slots for a teacher in 2 courses
ResponsesInList.Text: This is correct - Scheduler will prevent teachers from setting up such conflicting slots. Otherwise, teachers might end up with two bookings by two different students at the same time.

ResponsesInList.Title: How to extend flexibility?
ResponsesInList.Text: Students working part-time in addition to studying or having little children need different options to make appointments with their teacher. The challenge is to keep the organisation simple. It is a big advantage for teachers to schedule all appointments with their students in one single tool. Being asked for a teacher might make an appointment with a student that was not offered in one of the regular slots. Here the "volatile slots" would come in handy. The teacher could add a single slot for the appointment and reserve it for the student. Without setting it to be cancelled after being released the slot could be registered by other students. "Volatile slots" also come with the option to automatically send a reminder and with the option to cancel an appointment. Another nice to have feature would be the possibility to offer more slots but set the number of possible appointments per day/week/month to a maximum (n slots : m appointments, n > m). What do you think? Regards Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to extend flexibility?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Peter I'm sorry, the "volatile slots" are now gone for good - and in fact, since I proposed to remove them a year and a half ago, you're the first person to ask for them. I think that few people have ever made use of them (as far as they worked in the first place). From my personal experience in using Scheduler, there's a limit to the "one single tool" approach. There are always some special cases where I need to communicate directly by e-mail with students to make an appointment, or where I know that they need not/should not sign up for an appointment; for example, if students are ill, on a leave of absence, can't make any of the slots I offer for various reasons... I think these will always exist, and Scheduler cannot cater for all these special cases. I usually set up an appointment for these student in Scheduler once I've fixed the details with them by e-mail. Regarding more flexibility in how many appointments a student can book, that's an interesting idea; something related has been proposed before ( CONTRIB-5267 ). Feel free to add your views there, or to open a new feature request on the Tracker. I must say though that I'm not planning to implement this with priority; I'm not even sure what solution here would be best for most users. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Appointment cancelled or moved by a student
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Sue thanks for the log files. Yes, I think that has indeed helped. It appears the following has happened: After you clicked "Save my choice", your choice was correctly saved, a "new booking" e-mail generated, and the booking screen was again displayed to you. However, immediately afterwards, the page was then reloaded (but this time as a GET rather than POST request, to mention the details). Why this happened isn't clear to me - I reproduced it by clicking into the address bar of the browser and hitting "Enter", but maybe it's some browser feature unknown to me? In any case, this triggered a bug in Scheduler so that the choice was saved again, but this time with an empty list of slots. Hence your booking was cancelled. I have made a little change to the 2.7 version of Scheduler so that the problem should no longer occur. It's available from the MOODLE_27_STABLE branch on github. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Booking of several slots not working
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello I'm unsure whether I've fully understood the problem - in any case it seems to be a very unusual use case for the Scheduler module. Just to remark, you almost always will want to run your scheduler in "No groups" mode. Enabling "Visible groups" or "Separate groups" will, in version 2.7, mean that students can book their entire group into a slot; that's quite likely not what you want in your case. Also, note that students will always be able to change/drop their appointments (you say that "they can reject it as well"). This is intended, since otherwise they would not be able to correct a possible mistake (accidentally clicking on the wrong slot). You can, however, prevent students from changing their appointments a certain time before the slot. This is done with the "guard time" setting in the scheduler settings page.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students see can make appointments for Teachers not in their group
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I have exactly the same issue ! Suggestions welcome

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students see can make appointments for Teachers not in their group
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Currently, i.e., up to and including the current stable version (branch MOODLE_27_STABLE), Scheduler does not have any feature for restricting students to book only within their groups. Rather, the "Visible groups" / "Separate groups" setting is used to enable *booking in groups*; i.e., with group mode enabled, students can make an appointment for their entire group at the same time. ("Visible groups" and  "Separate groups" actually behave identically.) However, for the next release (Scheduler 2.9, I expect a release in early September), this behaviour will change, and it will allow to restrict students to appointments with teachers in their groups. For details see here: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=316797 The feature is available on the master branch on github and you're welcome to test it, but I would not recommend it for production use yet.

ResponsesInList.Title: Feature change: Group mode
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello a rather major change in the way that Scheduler handles groups has just reached the master branch. (This isn't ready for production use yet, but tests/feedback are welcome. It will be part of an upcoming 2.9 relase.) In previous versions, when you set the "Group mode" of the activity to either "Visible groups" or "Separate groups", then students were able to book into slots one group at a time. This was a bit out of line with how other parts of Moodle handle group mode , where it's more like an access restriction. Now, Scheduler has two group related features which are clearly separated. Group scheduling: This means that students can make a booking for their entire group, similar to earlier versions. The feature can be switched on or off at a per-activity level, using the new "Booking in groups" setting. Group mode: The "Visible groups" / "Separate groups" setting will now mean that the activity is "split in groups" in the usual Moodle sense: students can book a slot only with a teacher who is a member of the same group. Teachers who don't have the privilege to "access all groups" will also see a restricted set of slots only. The configuration settings will be migrated during upgrade; that is, if before upgrade you had a scheduler in "Visible groups" mode, then after upgrade it will have "Booking in groups" set to "yes" and its group mode set to "none". Please check your data after migration.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler message: No appointment required, or all the announced appointments are complete.
ResponsesInList.Text: This would normally mean that no slots are available to the student. Either no slots have been set up, or they aren't available (e.g. their "available from" date is in the future). It is also possible that the student is allowed to book only one appointment, and has already done so. A screenshot of the student screen and the teacher screen would help to isolate the problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler overview allows view of grades between unrelated courses
ResponsesInList.Text: My institution has a widespread requirement for a good slot booking plugin in Moodle, and I have been evaluating Scheduler as a potential solution. I have set up the following scenario, and the results raise concerns for us about leakage of students' grades between courses: Create Course A with users Student A and Teacher A. Create Scheduler A in Course A and enable grading. Teacher A books a slot with Student A, marks the student as seen and gives the student a grade. Also create Course B, but with users Student A, Teacher A and Teacher B. Create Scheduler B in Course B. Login as Teacher B (who is not enrolled in Course A). Go to the Scheduler Overview tab and filter the view by Teacher A. Teacher B is now able to see the grade given to the student by Teacher A, in a course that Teacher B is not enrolled on and cannot enter. I would be interested in knowing whether others who are using Scheduler view this as a feature or a bug. Are there any workarounds to prevent this happening? I know that we can downgrade the Teacher role capabilities to those of a Non-editing Teacher, but this leaves Teachers unable to book slots for other Teachers. Any comments or suggestions would be very welcome.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler overview allows view of grades between unrelated courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Erica yes, that's right: The "Overview" tab allows teachers to see data from other courses. That might seem a little unintuitive, since Moodle's "coursemodule instances" are normally completely isolated from each other, and access rights are maintained on the level of individual "coursemodules" (eg, Schedulers). However, to my understanding it's a feature, and one that has been in Scheduler for a very long time (back to Moodle 1.9, before I took over the maintenance of Scheduler). I haven't changed it since. I'm actually not so sure how useful the "Overview" feature, looking across all schedulers and courses, actually is. For what I'm concerned (or our institution), we could just restrict the data to the current scheduler or course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler overview allows view of grades between unrelated courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Henning, Thanks very much for this - the solution to the permissions concern that you've outlined on the tracker looks good for us (and would add extra flexibility as well). And thank you also for fixing the overview links issue so speedily!

ResponsesInList.Title: Redesigned export feature
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Scheduler users responding to various requests in the tracker, I have completely redesigned the export feature in Scheduler. It's now possible to: Select the data fields to be included in the export (e.g., student username, student e-mail), Export all appointments related to a slot (e.g., for use as a sign-up list), Create any export in a file format of your choice (CSV, Excel, ODS, HTML, PDF are supported). This is now available on the master branch on Github, and I'm planning to release it in a 2.9 branch of Scheduler later this year. Note that it's no longer possible to export the total grade of a student directly from Scheduler - it just didn't fit the overall scheme. However, you can use a gradebook export for this purpose. Feedback regarding the new export features is welcome; please comment here, in CONTRIB-5342 , or open a new entry in the tracker if you find a bug.

ResponsesInList.Title: Comments in export
ResponsesInList.Text: Would it be possible to change the Schedule plugin so that comments in slots are also exported to spreadsheet file?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Comments in export
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, please see CONTRIB-5342 .

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler Changes from Moodle 2.4 to 2.6?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, A staff member I'm trying to help has been using and appreciating the Moodle scheduler for years. So first off, thank for making and maintaining it. Now, on to a little problem. We just upgraded from Moodle 2.4 to 2.6. The scheduler works a bit different after the upgrade. One change is that the staff member I'm trying to help used to be able to remove students from a list off appointments by clicking the x on the right side of their name. Now in version 2.6, we can't figure out how to remove students from an appointment, at least the way we could in Moodle 2.4. Any suggestions?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler Changes from Moodle 2.4 to 2.6?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, you would click on the drop-down box in which you see the student's name, and from that drop-down, you would select the "empty" entry (at the top of the list, usually labelled "Choose..."

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler Changes from Moodle 2.4 to 2.6?
ResponsesInList.Text: Good afternoon I am the colleague to whom Steven Malikowski is referring.  I think it might be simpler for me to make request directly and I hope you are happy with this?!?  I spend approximately 20 hours a week on Moodle so I consider myself a heavy user.  I too am grateful for this system which works well in the main. Thank you for the Drop down 'choose' which appears to be a satisfactory solution. There are a couple of other issues that I have.  From the schedulers I have to create a sign in sheet; I used to do this by clicking on session and then clicking on the pencil/change button and then highlighting the list and copy and pasting but the list is no longer available.  The students are all separated by appointments so this method is no longer an option.  If I copy the front page I get 'Picture of student name,student name' which would mean having to delete the 'Picture of student name' for each individual student of which there are often 24. Also in the previous versions of Moodle when in the student role the students could click on a plus sign and find out who else had signed up for the session.  This has now become a red x/who's there?  It would be really helpful if this could be removed.  I would prefer students not know who else has signed up for the session.  Do you think this might be possible? Thank you for your assistance with this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler Changes from Moodle 2.4 to 2.6?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello sorry for the wait, and I hope you had a good holiday time. The screen that you see (or saw) when clicking the pencil/change button was really intended as an edit screen. It was never designed for exporting a signup sheet from it (which explains why its replacement in 2.6 isn't doing this). If you want to export a list of slots from the scheduler, you may want to use the "Exports" tab to save the slots as an Excel file. I'm not sure whether the output is exactly in the format you need, but Excel files are quite easy to edit, so you may be able to tweak the output to suit your needs. Regarding the button with the plus sign, you've found a bug in Scheduler 2.5 on Moodle 2.6. This will be fixed with the next maintenance update of Scheduler, due later this month. Alternatively, you can ask your system administrator to copy the graphics "/pix/t/switch_plus.gif" from a Moodle 2.4 or 2.5 installation to your Moodle 2.6 installation, which should also fix the problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler Changes from Moodle 2.4 to 2.6?

pasted them into a spreadsheet without having the need to export.  Is

please? I'm afraid that, at this time, the export will always display the names of all student in the same slot in a single cell. Regarding the second point, I was referring to a technical problem that is first present in Moodle 2.6. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler Changes from Moodle 2.4 to 2.6?
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Kim Sorry for not replying earlier. In order not to let students see who else has booked the same slot, you need to remove the capability ' mod/scheduler:seeotherstudentsbooking ' from the 'student' role. Depending on your setup and experience, a system administrator may need to do that for you. For general information roles and permissions in Moodle, see https://docs.moodle.org/28/en/Roles_and_permissions Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Group Booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Dears , couple of questions for group booking is there any way to force group booking , where the student cannot book the slot for himself only , either for the entire group or not. how to tell the scheduler to accept only one group booking by slot. assume I set maximum number of allowed students by slot to 5 , and the groupX has 3 students only, what I am looking for show this slot as booked for others  when booked for GroupX even there are 2 seats still available.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Group Booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I'm afraid Scheduler doesn't have these features at the moment. Strictly speaking there are no group slots - it's rather slots for several students into which a group can be booked, but no association to a group is maintained once the slot has been booked. At the moment, students will always have the choice whether to book for themselves or for a group, and there's no way of preventing two groups to book into the same slot, supposing that the slot has sufficient capacity.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Group Booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, how about just adding a column to the slots table which specifies the group/individual status of a slot? This should solve the original poster's problems and also the problems which arise from the fact that you can only drop yourself from a group appointment. You need the group association for dropping group appointments (to drop a group appointment for every member in a group), this could be implemented by reusing the "Appoint for"-dropdown menu. Basically the user selects which groups appointments to drop with the same dropdown menu and then the appointments are dropped for all members of that group, if the group appointment existed. Or maybe it would be better to add a separate dropdown menu. Are there other cases where that group association would be needed (= would it be more reasonable to add a slot-group association table)? Also it could be more user friendly to hide all slots that are already booked by some group. I can implement this if it sounds reasonable. I've chosen to use this plugin at my university, however I think that this group appointment problem needs to be solved somehow first. Please let me know if you have any suggestions or advice how to proceed. Should I add tickets to the issue tracker? Oh, another issue I had. Slot list pagination doesn't seem to work if the user is a student. I have a use case which requires for continous slots around the clock and without pagination the list becomes too big to use. BR, Pirkka

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Group Booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Pirkka As you may have noticed reading this forum, the group scheduling process is a quite complex issue. I agree that this is an area of Scheduler which might use some review in future versions. Some of the questions involved are: Should the booking be for a group, or for the individuals that were in the group at the time of booking? Can individual members of the group drop their own appointment (or that of the group)? Who can make an appointment for the group? Should grades be given on a per-person or per-group level? Should the same scheduler contain both group and individual appointments? These are just some of the questions to which different users may have different answers, and I'd be interested to hear what is actually required out there. However, the current group scheduling feature has been around in Scheduler - almost unmodified -  for 8 years or so, and I guess that a number of users rely on the current functionality as is, so changes have to be done with care. I'd also expect that any nontrivial changes to  group scheduling will trigger quite large-scale changes to the code. In short, I'm inviting opinions on this point, to find out what requirements and typical usage patterns actually are. But I'm not planning to implement (or integrate) major changes to the group scheduling feature in the short run. Regarding paging in the student view, this in fact doesn't exist at this time. However, you may want to vote for CONTRIB-5194 . (Zero people have voted for it so far.) Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Group Booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Pirkka , Henning I totally understand that making the plugin supports group booking and cover all related areas is complex and huge task. But why not start with the following ( just brain storming, I am not sure how complex to implement): In the scheduler setting  add an option to force group booking. if this option is chosen: the student will not have an option to book for himself only, the drop down will have only one option ( for the group). any one of the group members can make the appointment the time slot will be locked for any additional booking , even there are enough seats. I don't see any problem of keeping the option for the student to drop him/herself. it will be nice to give the instructor an option to revoke entire slot appointments I think this will be a good start , which can be enhanced in the future. regards wasim

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Group Booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Wasim thanks for your thoughts - it's good to know what would work for you. If others have thoughts about this as well, please do add your comments. There's plenty of time to discuss this; the next major release of Scheduler won't be available before May 2015 (at the earliest).

ResponsesInList.Title: Maximum students per slot
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm currently a user of moodle 2.6 inside a large university in the UK. I run a non credit-bearing English language support programme for International students which I administer through moodle. I currently allow students to sign up to workshops using the scheduler module in moodle. We had previously used the 'Choice' module but scheduler simplifies things by automating reminder emails and generally providing us with slightly better overall functionality and a bit more information. Unfortunately the ideal maximum number of students per slot would be around 25, but is presently limited to 18. We can't use the 'unlimited' option as unfortunately demand for the programme exceeds what we can deliver and this would be unworkable. We once accidentally set a workshop to unlimited and had over 40 signups in two hours - the workshop had to be cancelled. The e-learning team at my institution have advised that they are not able to set a maximum number higher than 18 due to the scheduler module itself. So, my question is: Is there any kind of workaround that the team at my institution may be unaware of? Having searched this problem before I feel like I have seen people alluding to having customized this. If not, is there any other method of working or other modules which might offer similar functionality to what I need without making administration of the scheme unworkable?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Maximum students per slot
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Tom, greetings from a medium-sized University in the UK. Scheduler has a global configuration option to set an upper limit for the maximum number of studens per slot. This can be accessed at Site administration ► Plugins ► Activity modules ► Scheduler (look for "Maximum number of students per slot"). You should increase this value to suit your needs. This will affect all users of the site, though, and will make the drop-down menus longer. I'm not quite sure why the value is 18 for your site. The default value is 9, so someone at your site must know how to change it. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Members in groups and "Allow multiple students per slot?"
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello everyone We use the plugin in moodle2.7 We have groups with 5 members in each. we want to create slots so one member of a group will chose the choice of his group (a slot) . I know that he need to select his group name before saving the choice. but I don't understand what I need to do  (as a teacher) in this setting: "Allow multiple students per slot?" How many student should I pick, 5 or 1? If I choose 1 - will all the group members be in the slot (after one of them choose them)? If I choose 5 - then 5 differnt students from different groups can pick it parallel? What should I do? Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Members in groups and "Allow multiple students per slot?"
ResponsesInList.Text: 5 is the setting you want. Once a group of 5 has booked into the slot, no one else will be able to book it. It might happen though that individual students book into the slot (from any group) - there's currently no way to prevent that.

ResponsesInList.Title: Can student choose a slot and then not letting him see other choices?
ResponsesInList.Text: I couldn't find a way to let a student choose a slot then save his changes and not letting him another option to choose something else.I was expecting him to see the rest of the slots disabled but he still can choose another slot. How can I make it be one choice each student and that it? I couldn't fine any setting that makes it happen/ Hope you can help me Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can student choose a slot and then not letting him see other choices?
ResponsesInList.Text: This is defined in the settings screen for each Scheduler. You can choose from either "Students can make 1 appointment at a time" or "Students can make 1 appointment in this scheduler" (or, in version 2.7 and beyond, you can also choose "2 appointments at a time" etc.). If you have chosen "Students can make 1 appointment in this scheduler", then exactly this should happen - once a student has booked a slot, they can not book another one. The can change their previous booking, though. If with these settings it doesn't work for you, then please let me know about details of your configuration (which version of Scheduler are you using, what settings did you choose, what does the student see - screenshots would be helful).

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendee's name is removed if slot is edited
ResponsesInList.Text:
Version 2014032400 Moodle 2.6 Instructor creates multiple slots Student select slots If an individual slot is then edited by the Instructor e.g.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendee's name is removed if slot is edited
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm afraid you're using an unstable version of Scheduler! Looking at your mod/scheduler/version.php, you will probably find the following line: $module->maturity = MATURITY_ALPHA; // Alpha development code - not for production sites Supposing you're using it on a test site, so that data loss is not a problem, what you should do first is to delete the Scheduler module from your site, and install the correct stable Scheduler version for your version of Moodle. In your case, that's currently 2013092705 (MOODLE_25_STABLE branch on github).

ResponsesInList.Title: "You can't start an appointment slot in the past"
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Schedule users, if I see it right, I can start an appointment in the past but only 9 days before the current date. Any attempts to create an appointment before ends with the error above. Why 9 days? And can this be changed somehow? Thanks Csaba

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: "You can't start an appointment slot in the past"
ResponsesInList.Text: That's right, you can't start an appointment slot in the past. In some earlier version (back in Moodle 1.9 times, when Valery Fremaux was the maintainer), Scheduler was very strict at this point and didn't accept any slot dates/times in the past at all. The idea is that setting up a slot with a date in the past isn't useful, as it cannot be booked by anyone (in fact, Scheduler would delete such slots if they are empty). However, this sometimes lead to problems when teachers were correcting data of slots that had just recently been attended (they might be editing the data for record keeping purposes). Therefore, I decided to make Scheduler more "lenient" at this point and allow slot times slightly in the past. The cutoff of 10 days in the past is, I admit, completely arbitrary but it has so far been sufficient for practical purposes. At the moment, there's no configuration setting or similar with which the 10 days period might be changed. That might be improved, but I'm not quite sure what the expected behaviour should be and why - who really needs to set up appointments in the past?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: "You can't start an appointment slot in the past"
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the detailed answer. A teacher uses the scheduler to document her appointments afterwards, that's why this question came up. I think if there is a setting for this then everyone can decide to use it or not. Thanks Csaba

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: "You can't start an appointment slot in the past"
ResponsesInList.Text: For upcoming releases of Scheduler (i.e. 2.7 onwards), I have now changed the behaviour as follows: Appointment slots can be created/edited in the past (without restriction to -10 days) *if* there's at least one student in the slot. If the slot is empty, however, i.e. if no student is assigned, then you can't set the slot date into the past. I hope this improves the situation.

ResponsesInList.Title: Slots Time AM/PM
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scheduler users! again here, i currently present a problem with my module: $ MODULE-> version = 2013092702; $ MODULE-> release = '2.5.1'; Human-friendly version // name $ MODULE-> requires = 2013051400; Requires // Moodle 2.5 $ MODULE-> = MATURITY_STABLE maturity; Stable branch // $ MODULE-> cron = 60; // Period for cron to check this module (secs) i am using Moodle version in the 2.6.3 (Build: 20140512). It turns out that in the course settings, force the Spanish language of mexico and shows me the time in the 24 hours, and  I want 12 hour format and read AM / PM, with the language of Spain if you show me the 12 hours but does not specify AM / PM, this which will bring confusion among students and teachers, any suggestions?? i  changed the file langConfig EN_US_UTF8 and if it shows me 12 hours with your AM-PM,  but this change the days and months in English. Please if someone can guide, I will be very grateful. Greetings and happy day.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Slots Time AM/PM
ResponsesInList.Text: You say that you tried to customize the English language pack; did you try customizing the corresponding string in the Spanish language pack too? (See Site administration -> Language - >Language customizations)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Slots Time AM/PM
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Henning, Thanks for your answer, I will try explain better. I've customized the chains of language: Spanish / mexico in Home / ► Site administration / ► Language / ► Language Customisation -> langconfig.php, I replaced these values % H:% M% l by this value:% M% p in different strings, but it has not worked, show me the value of 12 hours but does not show me if AM / PM. I also tried changing the core_langconfig - locale (es_MX.UTF-8) by en_AU.UTF-8 and in the scheduler, works! but not completely because it also show the days on English. I tried changing the core_langconfig - locale (es_MX.UTF-8) by en_US.UTF-8 and the scheduler displays the time with 12-hour format but without AM / PM I need to know if the locale file (es_MX.UTF-8 and en_US.UTF-8) has to do with this? is there any way to fix ?. I took several screenshots to be better appreciated. Thank you very much for your answer Regards Susan Ruiz

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Slots Time AM/PM
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Susan thanks for this detailed explanation. I can reproduce the behaviour that you describe, and I must say it puzzled me for a while. The solution is, in short, as follows. You have correctly configured the time format (core_langconfig / strftimetime) to include the AM / PM part. (I would not change core_langconfig / locale though.) However, it turns out that the localized value for the English text "AM"/"PM" in the Spanish (Mexico) locale is, in the default configuration, just the empty string. That is, someone thinks that "AM" in English translates to "" in Mexican Spanish. Now this translation is not determined by Scheduler. In fact, it's not determined by Moodle either, and not even by PHP. As it turns out, it is determined by the operating system . On my Linux (Ubuntu 14.04) machine, I solved the problem as follows. I edited the file /usr/share/i18n/locales/es_MX and replaced the line am_pm   "";"" with am_pm  "<U0041><U004D>";"<U0050><U004D>" Then I ran "sudo locale-gen". This finally makes the AM/PM text correctly show up in the scheduler on Moodle. (Weird enough!) Of course, since all this is operating system dependent, it may look very different on your machine. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Slots Time AM/PM
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Henning, Wow got you to thinking, thank you very much for your answer, now I  just waiting for the response of a guru A2Hosting that is where hosting my site moodle, because as I enter via ssh I have not root permissions to change the local file, Thank you very much and have a nice day. Regards from Venezuela. Susan Ruiz

ResponsesInList.Title: How to use multiple scheduler instances in a course?
ResponsesInList.Text: We would like to have teachers create their available slots in one scheduler instance in a course and have students able to pick a slot from any other instance in the course. Currently, slots are only visible to the student in the instance where they were created. The file index.php alludes to creating a table of instances within a course.  How can you accomplish what we require?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to use multiple scheduler instances in a course?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, sorry, appointments can be booked only in the same scheduler instance that they were created in. (This is in line with Moodle's concept of "activity modules" - data is kept within the same activity module instance.) Probably you should consider using only one scheduler instance in the course - it depends on your use case. The "index.php" just lists all scheduler instances within a course. Every activity module has this kind of file; cf. mod/assign/index.php , mod/quiz/index.php and others.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to use multiple scheduler instances in a course?
ResponsesInList.Text: I will however have to break the scheduler code because it cannot work in our courses. You're welcome to modify the code to suit your needs, of course - it's open source - just to warn you that when making modifications of that type you're in danger of breaking other parts of Scheduler. Teachers can in fact not set up identical slots in different schedulers. This is to avoid scheduling conflicts: Otherwise, teachers might end up with several appointments at the same time. You might be interested in a new feature that will be introduced in the upcoming 2.7 release of Scheduler: Students can book several appointments in the same scheduler, but only one at a time (until the teacher marks the previous appointment as "seen"). See CONTRIB-1761 for details.

ResponsesInList.Title: Testing for Scheduler 2.7
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Scheduler users Some of you may have wondered when there will be a Moodle 2.7 version of Scheduler. Well, I've been doing some work on the master branch recently and the 2.7 version of Scheduler should be released soon, i.e., in July or August. Your help in testing would be much appreciated. Please note that the current master branch should not be used on production systems, it's for development/testing only! Wait for the "official" release, there will be a MOODLE_27_STABLE branch. For the changes: Although you won't see so much from the user prespective, I've been cleaning up and rewriting a lot of old code paticularly in the student and teacher views. This also included a complete rewrite of all Javascript code (now based on YUI3) and some security enhancements (sessionid checking is now used throughout). While I have fixed some old bugs in the process, I'm sure that I have introduced some new ones as well; I really rely on you to find them! Feature changes: You can now allow students to book several appointments at once. (This does not work together with group scheduling, though.) You can specify, on the activity level, a " guard time " to prevent late changes of slots. If, for example, the guard time is 2 days, then students will be able to book new appointments only if they are at least 2 days ahead, and they can't drop appointments if they are closer than 2 days. The "volatile slots" feature, on the other hand, has been removed. Also, Scheduler now supports the new logging API (Event 2). At the moment, I've added only very few events, basically when a student views the booking screen, adds or removes a booking. There are certainly dozens of other events that one might define as well, particularly on the teacher side, but I'm not sure which ones would really be useful. If you're missing any event definition / logging feature desperately, let me know. Areas that need review in the future, but that I didn't manage to cover this time, include exports ( CONTRIB-4131 ), notification messages ( CONTRIB-4647 ), and student-supplied data ( CONTRIB-4924 , CONTRIB-4690 , CONTRIB-4199 ). If you want to help in testing, please check out the master branch to a Moodle 2.7 (or 2.8dev) installation, and report any issues to the tracker ( https://tracker.moodle.org ) . Be as specific as you can regarding which version of the code you're using - it's best to mention when you last updated from github (as the code may change frequently at this point). Thanks in advance! In particular, there are some bugs listed on the tracker that I had trouble reproducing. If anyone can shed a light on whether they occur with the latest version, this would be very helpful. Best wishes

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Testing for Scheduler 2.7
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks to everyone who helped with the testing so far. Just to keep you updated with time plans: As I won't be available for quick responses until mid-August, I will delay the 2.7 release until then. If you find further problems with the beta version (the master branch), please add tracker issues as appropriate.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduling a student - what do you *actually* use?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello all, here's a short question to Scheduler users, which however needs some explanation. Teachers can, at any time, create appointments for students by editing the corresponding slot (clicking "edit" in the list of slots) and adding the student there. However, there are also some shortcuts for the same task, namely via the "Schedule" and "Mark as seen now" buttons in the list of students. The screens used for these have changed a bit in the latest version as I have reorganized the underlying code. It seems that they can still use some fine-tuning (cf. CONTRIB-5134 ), and I have always felt that it's a bit unclear whether Scheduler does at that point what users actually want. Therefore, I wanted to do a quick opinion poll: which of the following scenarios are actually relevant in your use of Scheduler? a) The teacher selects a student, then enters date and time for a new appointment. b) The teacher selects a student, then selects an existing slot to schedule the student in this slot (without further modifications to the slot). c) The teacher selects a student, then selects an existing slot and edits the slot data (e.g., changes location, slot description, date or time).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduling a student - what do you *actually* use?
ResponsesInList.Text: I've seen mostly B, but with clearer text, D seems OK. More often than not, I think the answer on our campus is, doesn't do anything in scheduler, overrides grade in gradebook.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduling a student - what do you *actually* use?
ResponsesInList.Text: The way we use Scheduler most frequently is to emulate a 'sign up sheet', that is, Teacher posts a list of available slots and student selects the one they want.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduling a student - what do you *actually* use?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for your responses so far - and please keep adding more. However, it seems to me from the number of responses that this is not such an urgent issue; I might return to it in a later release.

But the email still arrives in English. Am I doing something wrong? In fact, my preferred solution is more complicated - I have a situation where I have users of multiple
languages/nationalities. I would like them to receive the automatic
reminder email in their preferred languages (as set in their Moodle
profile), but for the admin interface to remain in English. How
