ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Cannot backup courses with scheduler module
ResponsesInList.Text: Catched : Indeed, you do need also need locallib.php in restore for the same reasons. I moved all module internal functions to locallib for API clarity, restorelib.php was not aware of that. I found also a misnamed function §95 $status = scheduler_appointment s _restore_mods ($mod->id, $newid, $info, $restore); needs a 's'. Finally, in case you use other modules from ethnoinformatique.fr, you moight protect the last function declaration in locallib.php, just like this. /** * adds an error css marker in case of matching error * @param array $errors the current error set * @param string $errorkey */ if (!function_exists('print_error_class')){ function print_error_class($errors, $errorkeylist){ if ($errors){ foreach($errors as $anError){ if ($anError->on == '') continue; if (preg_match("/\\b{$anError->on}\\b/" ,$errorkeylist)){ echo " class=\"formerror\" "; return; } } } } } this is I confess, an architectural irresolution of this module set, that used a redundant utility function in several modules, as we have no common "third-party" lib space that would be easily usable for making blind installs. I checked that some data actually do not restore in the scheduler. I work on it before publishing next release. I'll fix all this in release 8. I will add a little enhancement to release 8, that is, allowing to distribute grade and/or comment on all participants of the slot when grading the appointment. This would fasten operations when concluding a grouped meeting. Cheers.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler in release 7 !!
ResponsesInList.Text: Major improvements : A new site wide parameter allows a teacher to grade appointments of other teachers. This may be usefull in "collegial" jurys. This parameter is site-wide, so it must turned on only by site administrator and cannot be overriden in each scheduler. Scheduler instance owner should use roles and derogations to avoid some other users to grade appointments. Groups scheduling : It will be now possible to schedule a Moodle group (defined in course) in three clicks. The interface let you schedule individuals or by group. Other things on this release : fixes instance deletion that was wrong. Other known stuff to check : There is still some uncertainties on backup/restore. Get it at ethnoinformatique.fr distribution center .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Urgent! Problem with more than 1 scheduler instances in one course
ResponsesInList.Text: For urgent answer, try this, wich is an obvious error : Query in studentview.php §37 should have shown : $ sql = " SELECT COUNT(*) FROM {$CFG->prefix}scheduler_slots AS s, {$CFG->prefix}scheduler_appointment AS a WHERE s.id = a.slotid AND a.studentid = {$USER->id} AND a.attended = 1 AND s.schedulerid = {$scheduler->id} "; This could have a serious influence on multiple instance cross-influence. (Untried yet).

I just enrolled in your course and will report there from now on. It's great that you replied so quickly. Greatly appreciated. Michael

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Urgent! Problem with more than 1 scheduler instances in one course
ResponsesInList.Text: Best is you report as quickly as you did a misbehaviour with the (most) exact situation. There are things odd that will appear only when the module is used in a "very near limits" environment. The course settings I made on www.ethnoinformatique.fr for handling module support is precisely to be able to track up bugs in a couple of hours delay, and to keep that kind of delay even when the offer will grow (which is the real nightmare as you are distributing more and more modules !). By the way, could you send me german translations for four new keys, please ? $string['availableslots'] = 'Available slots'; $string['availableslotsowned'] = 'Owned'; $string['availableslotsnotowned'] = 'Not owned'; $string['availableslotsall'] = 'All slots'; Keep on arguing here on Moodle forums as we can discuss about enhancement opportunities, and still get the opinion of the Moodle community. Note that I'm still planning regular enhancements to scheduler module based on my own experience of the module : Next published version has an overall statistics page added to check about registered, appointed, seen, to see, to appoint, missing or unregistered, and finally available slots count, so we can check very quickly the situaiton of a massive appointement process, and know so quickly if we had set enough slots for it. (implemented yet). I plan changing the slot table to a Flexitable, so that it could be sorted, filtered. I still wonder if these features are really valuable. There were some requirements for programming an appointement directly by picking a Moodle group in the course context . This could be fine I think. There is a plan to display a calendarize view of the available slots, such as a cellbar over the slot list (for students) giving "paged access" to the 15 following days from "now", eventually sliding over future time. This might propose a cleaner view to students to check to appoint that day rather than that other day. Last but not least, I'm studying the situation where the module could be used for managing "enrolement appointements" for externals which just should have to have a temporary account binded to an additional role "Prospect" or something like that. Least at last . I plan an additional switch to unlock grading possibility to a non owner of a slot. That is right now, if you assign a set of slots to a teacher, only that teacher will be able to give a grade to the appointment, also he can attend the appointment. Adding that switch would let choose a more "liberal" and "collegial" way to manage appointment resolution. All these are prospective. I would react on "popularity" indication for that or this feature... Have not so many time... Thank for arguing, if interested or concerned, of course.
